node.name: grain burgers
node.steps: ['toast seeds and spices:', 'toast the sesame seeds for 2 minutes in a hot skillet , taking care not to burn them', 'add the coriander , cumin , and chile powder and cook for 10 seconds longer , so that all spices are aromatic', 'turn onto a plate to cool', 'prepare bean mixture:', 'in a large bowl , mash the beans with a potato masher or fork , then add the rice and 1 / 3 cup wheat germ', 'prepare scallions and garlic:', 'in a medium skillet , heat the oil over medium heat , and add the scallions , garlic , and toasted spices', 'cook until softened , then remove from heat and add to the mashed bean mixture', 'prepare burgers:', 'add salt and pepper to the mashed bean mixture , and mix well with hands', 'shape into four 3 / 4-inch thick patties', 'pour remaining 1 / 3 cup wheat germ on a plate , and press patties in it , coating both sides', 'grill , broil , or saute patties for about 3 minutes per side , or until nicely golden', 'serve burgers on pita breads , or buns , topped with tomato slices and lettuce or spinach leaves']
node.description: entered for safe-keeping, from sean donnellan's "something tastes funny", with recipes by naidre miller. this cookbook is geared to new cooks and non-cooks. these will grill without crumbling on a grill. for a grain and cheese vegetarian burger, try recipe #165678 #165678.
node.ingredients: ['sesame seeds', 'ground coriander', 'ground cumin', 'pure chile powder', 'garbanzo beans', 'cooked brown rice', 'wheat germ', 'canola oil', 'scallions', 'garlic cloves', 'salt', 'fresh ground black pepper', 'pita breads', 'tomatoes', 'lettuce leaves']
node.step_1: toast seeds and spices:
node.step_2: toast the sesame seeds for 2 minutes in a hot skillet , taking care not to burn them
node.step_3: add the coriander , cumin , and chile powder and cook for 10 seconds longer , so that all spices are aromatic
node.step_4: turn onto a plate to cool
node.step_5: prepare bean mixture:
node.step_6: in a large bowl , mash the beans with a potato masher or fork , then add the rice and 1 / 3 cup wheat germ
node.step_7: prepare scallions and garlic:
node.step_8: in a medium skillet , heat the oil over medium heat , and add the scallions , garlic , and toasted spices
node.step_9: cook until softened , then remove from heat and add to the mashed bean mixture
node.step_10: prepare burgers:
node.step_11: add salt and pepper to the mashed bean mixture , and mix well with hands
node.step_12: shape into four 3 / 4-inch thick patties
node.step_13: pour remaining 1 / 3 cup wheat germ on a plate , and press patties in it , coating both sides
node.step_14: grill , broil , or saute patties for about 3 minutes per side , or until nicely golden
node.step_15: serve burgers on pita breads , or buns , topped with tomato slices and lettuce or spinach leaves

node.name: gram s chinese pepper steak

node.description: this is a tasty way to stretch a little meat a long way and is easy to prepare...both important considerations when feeding a large family!
node.ingredients: ['sesame oil', 'round steak', 'celery', 'green peppers', 'yellow onion', 'black pepper', 'red pepper flakes', 'powdered ginger', 'salt', 'brown sugar', 'thyme leaves', 'water', 'diced tomatoes', 'cornstarch', 'soy sauce']
node.step_1: sear steak strips in oil in a large skillet or dutch oven
node.step_2: add celery , peppers , and onion to the meat in the skillet and stir fry for 5 minutes
node.step_3: add the black pepper , pepper flakes , ginger , salt , brown sugar , thyme , and water
node.step_4: turn the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes
node.step_5: then add the can of tomatoes
node.step_6: mix the brown sugar , cornstarch , soy sauce , and 1 / 4 cup of water together and then add to the meat and vegetables
node.step_7: stir gently while the sauce thickens
node.step_8: serve over rice or mashed potatoes

node.name: grammie bea s chocolate no bake cookies
node.steps: ['mix the sugar , cocoa , butter , and milk in a med', 'saucepan , and heat over med', 'heat , stirring occasionally , until mixture comes to a boil', 'let mixture boil for 2 1 / 2 mins', ', then remove from heat', 'stir in the peanut butter , vanilla , and oats', 'if you are adding coconut and / or raisins , add at this time too', 'if it looks on the runny side and soft , add another 1 / 2 cup oats gradually , until desired thickness , and mix well', "you don't want them to spread out too much when you drop them onto the wax paper", 'working quickly , drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper or aluminum foil', 'let cool', 'the serving size is approximate , as it depends on how big you make them']
node.description: these cookies taste more like a heavenly piece of fudge than they do a cookie, and they are definately "on the top of my list". yum!!! they have been around for years, and every recipe is basically the same, but this one has a few additions, and i don't see any posted that are exactly like this one, so i wanted to share it with you... enjoy!

node.step_2: saucepan , and heat over med
node.step_3: heat , stirring occasionally , until mixture comes to a boil
node.step_4: let mixture boil for 2 1 / 2 mins
node.step_5: , then remove from heat
node.step_6: stir in the peanut butter , vanilla , and oats
node.step_7: if you are adding coconut and / or raisins , add at this time too
node.step_8: if it looks on the runny side and soft , add another 1 / 2 cup oats gradually , until desired thickness , and mix well
node.step_9: you don't want them to spread out too much when you drop them onto the wax paper

node.description: this recipe was my great grandmother's favorite! we found the actual recipe card in her box after she passed away. i've tried this recipe on several occasions and i really love how simple and delicious it is. she actually wrote the following words on her recipe card, "it never fails!"
node.ingredients: ['apples', 'sugar', 'cinnamon', 'unsifted flour', 'brown sugar', 'margarine']

node.step_3: toss them with 2 tablespoons sugar and 1 teaspoons cinnamon
node.step_4: place apples in an 8x8 baking dish
node.step_5: in a separate bowl , mix flour , brown sugar , 1 / 2 teaspoons cinnamon and margarine
node.step_6: sprinkle mixture over apples and bake for 40-45 minutes
node.step_7: according to grammy , this should be served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and whipped cream

node.name: grand marnier rice pudding
node.steps: ['in a medium saucepan , bring milk , sugar , rice and salt to a boil , stirring frequently', 'reduce heat and simmer about 20 minutes , stirring occasionally', 'lightly beat egg in a medium bowl', 'gradually stir about a fourth of the hot milk mixture into the egg', 'return to pan , stirring constantly', 'simmer for 20 minutes , stirring occasionally , until mixture is thick and rice is tender', 'remove from heat', 'stir in liqueur , vanilla and butter , stirring until butter melts']
node.description: lightly orange-scented creamy rice pudding.
node.ingredients: ['milk', 'arborio rice', 'sugar', 'salt', 'egg', 'grand marnier', 'butter', 'vanilla']
node.step_1: in a medium saucepan , bring milk , sugar , rice and salt to a boil , stirring frequently
node.step_2: reduce heat and simmer about 20 minutes , stirring occasionally
node.step_3: lightly beat egg in a medium bowl
node.step_4: gradually stir about a fourth of the hot milk mixture into the egg
node.step_5: return to pan , stirring constantly
node.step_6: simmer for 20 minutes , stirring occasionally , until mixture is thick and rice is tender
node.step_7: remove from heat
node.step_8: stir in liqueur , vanilla and butter , stirring until butter melts

node.name: grandma brown s gingerbread
node.steps: ['grease well either a 9 x 13 baking pan or two 9-inch round pans', 'cut a piece of parchment or waxed paper to fit bottom of pan', 'cream sugar and shortening together', 'mix dry ingredients together', 'add the molasses and boiling water to the sugar and shortening mixture , then slowly add dry ingredients to this mixture', 'mixing well between each addition', 'beat eggs well', 'add into mixture last', 'pour into prepared pan', 'bake at 350 or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean', 'best when served warm with fresh whipped cream , but delicious any time']
node.description: grandma brown was my great-grandmother on my father's side. i never got to meet her, but i remember my grandma making her gingerbread. last christmas, i made a bunch of it up and gave it to my family. now, i give it to you. enjoy! due to feedback, i am adding another comment here...old-fashioned gingerbread is a dense cake. if that is not what you expect from gingerbread, then this recipe is probably not for you.
node.ingredients: ['sugar', 'shortening', 'molasses', 'boiling water', 'baking soda', 'baking powder', 'flour', 'eggs', 'ginger', 'cinnamon']
node.step_1: grease well either a 9 x 13 baking pan or two 9-inch round pans
node.step_2: cut a piece of parchment or waxed paper to fit bottom of pan
node.step_3: cream sugar and shortening together
node.step_4: mix dry ingredients together
node.step_5: add the molasses and boiling water to the sugar and shortening mixture , then slowly add dry ingredients to this mixture
node.step_6: mixing well between each addition
node.step_7: beat eggs well
node.step_8: add into mixture last
node.step_9: pour into prepared pan
node.step_10: bake at 350 or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean
node.step_11: best when served warm with fresh whipped cream , but delicious any time

node.name: grandma chics carrot cake 1968
node.steps: ['cake method: beat eggs , and gradually add the sugar blend in the grated carrots sift the dry ingredients together and add alternately with the salad oil blend in the vanilla add the nuts add the raisins or pineapple pour into prepared pan bake the first 45 minutes at 375 degrees', 'remove from oven with a large handle of a wooden spoon or skewer poke holes all over the cake', 'down to bottom', 'pour topping into holes and all over top place back into oven for the last 15 minutes 375 degrees', 'test with a tester , should come away clean', 'when done remove from oven place onto a cooling rack', 'cool completely when cool glaze with a coffee glaze over the top and over the sides']
node.description: yummmmy yummmmy in my tummmmy cake !!!!!!! my mom-in-law, finally gave this recipe to me in 1968, after every weekend out at the cottage, i would eat it all up, and leave nothing for them to take home. there's always a new way to get their prized recipes.......375 degrees oven 45 minutes, remove poke holes place on filling and return to 375 degrees oven last 15 minutes, 9 1/2 cup greased and floured tube pan. remember also if you use a bundt pan they have a tendency to cook faster, and if not careful could result in a drier cake. also i like to make the holes for the topping with the handle of a wooden spoon that way everything goes into the cake a little better, leaving only a slight amount on top.
node.ingredients: ['fresh carrots', 'eggs', 'granulated sugar', 'golden raisins', 'all-purpose flour', 'salt', 'cinnamon', 'baking powder', 'ground nutmeg', 'baking soda', 'canola oil', 'vanilla extract', 'walnuts', 'butter', 'brown sugar', 'carnation evaporated milk', 'nuts', 'water', 'instant coffee granules', 'icing sugar']
node.step_1: cake method: beat eggs , and gradually add the sugar blend in the grated carrots sift the dry ingredients together and add alternately with the salad oil blend in the vanilla add the nuts add the raisins or pineapple pour into prepared pan bake the first 45 minutes at 375 degrees
node.step_2: remove from oven with a large handle of a wooden spoon or skewer poke holes all over the cake
node.step_3: down to bottom
node.step_4: pour topping into holes and all over top place back into oven for the last 15 minutes 375 degrees
node.step_5: test with a tester , should come away clean
node.step_6: when done remove from oven place onto a cooling rack
node.step_7: cool completely when cool glaze with a coffee glaze over the top and over the sides

node.name: grandma chiesa s ravioli
node.steps: ['saut onions until translucent', 'add pork and beef , salt , and pepper', 'saut until cooked', 'break up ground meat into small pieces', 'add 2 minced garlic cloves and cook another two minutes', 'let cool', 'lightly saut spinach in butter or olive oil', 'salt very lightly', 'chop spinach up', 'squeeze out excess water', 'you can use two packages of whole leaf frozen spinach cooked with butter and a little salt', 'mix ricotta and egg together', 'mix all above in a large bowl', 'put a small teaspoon of filling in wrapper and brush edges of dough with egg using pastry brush', 'put another wrapper on top and press edges flat together to seal', 'place two sheets of waxed paper in the bottom of a large tupperware container', 'sprinkle paper with corn meal', 'lay one layer of ravioli on waxed paper in container', 'do not overlap ravioli', 'sprinkle ravioli with cornmeal', 'add another 2 layers of waxed paper to container', 'sprinkle with cornmeal', "keep going until you're done", 'they stack well , and they freeze well', 'to cook , simmer 4-6 minutes in boiling water']
node.description: this recipe came from my grandma chiesa, and is absolutely the best. i'm 63, so you can figure how old the recipe is. it's authentic except for the wonton wrappers -- she made her own ravioli dough, which you can do, too. however, my sisters and i find the wrappers to be as good as her dough was, and some ravioli dough recipes to be not half as good.

node.step_1: saut onions until translucent
node.step_2: add pork and beef , salt , and pepper
node.step_3: saut until cooked
node.step_4: break up ground meat into small pieces
node.step_5: add 2 minced garlic cloves and cook another two minutes
node.step_6: let cool
node.step_7: lightly saut spinach in butter or olive oil
node.step_8: salt very lightly
node.step_9: chop spinach up
node.step_10: squeeze out excess water
node.step_11: you can use two packages of whole leaf frozen spinach cooked with butter and a little salt
node.step_12: mix ricotta and egg together
node.step_13: mix all above in a large bowl
node.step_14: put a small teaspoon of filling in wrapper and brush edges of dough with egg using pastry brush
node.step_15: put another wrapper on top and press edges flat together to seal
node.step_16: place two sheets of waxed paper in the bottom of a large tupperware container
node.step_17: sprinkle paper with corn meal
node.step_18: lay one layer of ravioli on waxed paper in container
node.step_19: do not overlap ravioli
node.step_21: add another 2 layers of waxed paper to container
node.step_24: they stack well , and they freeze well
node.step_25: to cook , simmer 4-6 minutes in boiling water

node.description: this has been our family's favorite recipe for thanksgiving for over 100 years, straight from old kentucky. the breads can be prepared 2-3 days ahead and left in oven to dry. i use jiffy instant mix though it is sweet corn bread. the celery and onions can be diced and left in the refrigerator the day before. the seasonings can be mixed together the day before.

node.name: grandma dolores irish soda bread
node.steps: ['place lemon juice into the bottom of a glass measuring cup and pour in enough milk to fill to the 1 cup mark-do not stir !', 'leave milk on your counter for 1 hour- during this time , measure out all of your other ingredients , but wait to set out the butter until the last 15 minutes', 'preheat oven to 350f and grease a round cake pan or pie plate', 'sift together flour , baking soda , baking powder , sugar , and salt', 'using a pastry blender or two knives , cut in the butter chunks until evenly mixed in and mixture looks grainy', 'stir in dried fruits and caraway seeds', "pour the milk mixture into the bowl and stir with a wooden spoon until all ingredients are moistened- don't overmix", 'dough will still be tacky at this point but will pick up more flour while kneading', 'sprinkle some flour onto a flat surface and scape dough onto the floured surface', 'flour your hands and knead the dough gently until it forms a ball- no more than 2 minutes or you will toughen the dough , and it may be less than that depending upon the humidity of the day', 'place dough ball into prepared pan and flatten slightly into a thick disk', 'using a serrated knife , make a deep cross in the surface of the bread', 'bake until golden brown and until bread sounds hollow on the bottom when rapped , about 35-45 minutes']
node.description: i got this recipe from my grandmother, who is part irish. i have always loved this soda bread recipe and make it every year for st. patrick's day. even though the seeds are listed as optional, i consider them a key flavor. if you can't find them, it will taste be tasty bread, but i much prefer the caraway flavor in there.
node.ingredients: ['all-purpose flour', 'baking soda', 'baking powder', 'granulated sugar', 'salt', 'sweet unsalted butter', 'golden raisins', 'dried currant', 'caraway seeds', 'fresh lemon juice', 'milk']
node.step_1: place lemon juice into the bottom of a glass measuring cup and pour in enough milk to fill to the 1 cup mark-do not stir !
node.step_2: leave milk on your counter for 1 hour- during this time , measure out all of your other ingredients , but wait to set out the butter until the last 15 minutes
node.step_3: preheat oven to 350f and grease a round cake pan or pie plate
node.step_4: sift together flour , baking soda , baking powder , sugar , and salt
node.step_5: using a pastry blender or two knives , cut in the butter chunks until evenly mixed in and mixture looks grainy
node.step_6: stir in dried fruits and caraway seeds
node.step_7: pour the milk mixture into the bowl and stir with a wooden spoon until all ingredients are moistened- don't overmix
node.step_8: dough will still be tacky at this point but will pick up more flour while kneading
node.step_9: sprinkle some flour onto a flat surface and scape dough onto the floured surface
node.step_10: flour your hands and knead the dough gently until it forms a ball- no more than 2 minutes or you will toughen the dough , and it may be less than that depending upon the humidity of the day
node.step_11: place dough ball into prepared pan and flatten slightly into a thick disk
node.step_12: using a serrated knife , make a deep cross in the surface of the bread
node.step_13: bake until golden brown and until bread sounds hollow on the bottom when rapped , about 35-45 minutes

node.step_2: divide into two crusts
node.step_3: you can use , refrigerate or freeze them
node.step_4: enjoy !

node.name: grandma g s baked thanksgiving turkey
node.steps: ['preheat oven to 450 degrees', 'remove giblets and neck', 'for those of you who have never cooked a turkey before , check inside the body cavity , and inside the neck chest cavity', 'rinse turkey and pat dry', 'mix melted butter and salad dressing', 'draw up mixture into injector and inject bird in several locations in the brest , thighs and leg', 'place in roaster pan and add all vegetables inside the body cavity', 'cut 4 , 1 / 2 inch slices from the butter and insert under the breast skin , and push up as far as it will go', 'place the remaining stick of butter in the cavity', 'cover with heavy foil , making sure the foil does not touch the turkey', 'bake for 2 hours 30 minutes in 450 degree oven', "if meat thermometer reads 185 degrees , it's time to uncover and baste using all of basting liquid", 'if it has not reached 180 degrees return to oven for additional 30 minutes', 'check therometer', 'bake another 45 minutes , until golden brown', 'remove from oven and cover with foil again and let stand for 15 minutes before slicing']
node.description: the secret for my buttery tasting moist turkey, is the injector! yes the large
node.ingredients: ['turkey', 'italian salad dressing', 'butter', 'celery', 'onion', 'carrots']
node.step_1: preheat oven to 450 degrees
node.step_2: remove giblets and neck
node.step_3: for those of you who have never cooked a turkey before , check inside the body cavity , and inside the neck chest cavity
node.step_4: rinse turkey and pat dry
node.step_5: mix melted butter and salad dressing
node.step_6: draw up mixture into injector and inject bird in several locations in the brest , thighs and leg
node.step_7: place in roaster pan and add all vegetables inside the body cavity
node.step_8: cut 4 , 1 / 2 inch slices from the butter and insert under the breast skin , and push up as far as it will go
node.step_9: place the remaining stick of butter in the cavity
node.step_10: cover with heavy foil , making sure the foil does not touch the turkey
node.step_11: bake for 2 hours 30 minutes in 450 degree oven
node.step_12: if meat thermometer reads 185 degrees , it's time to uncover and baste using all of basting liquid
node.step_13: if it has not reached 180 degrees return to oven for additional 30 minutes
node.step_14: check therometer
node.step_15: bake another 45 minutes , until golden brown
node.step_16: remove from oven and cover with foil again and let stand for 15 minutes before slicing

node.name: grandma o s sour cream pork chops
node.steps: ['preheat oven to 325 degrees', 'rinse pork chops and pat dry with a paper towel', 'sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper', 'heat oil and butter in a large frying pan over medium heat', 'mix together flour , seasoned salt and garlic powder in a pie dish', 'dredge pork chops in flour mixture and brown both sides in oil mixture', 'remove chops from pan when browned and crisp', 'pour out oil from pan and heat water and bouillon cubes until dissolved', 'add soup and sour cream to the pan and heat through , adding salt and pepper to taste', 'pour 1 / 4 mixture of sauce into a 9x13 pan and spread around', 'place chops in pan and top with onions and peppers', 'sprinkle more salt and pepper over chops , then cover with remaining sauce', 'cover with tin foil and bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes', 'add more water to pan if needed to thin sauce and back at 350 degrees for another 15 minutes', 'serve over egg noodles or white rice']
node.description: my mom made these pork chops a lot when we were growning up. just the thought of them makes my mouth water!
node.ingredients: ['pork chops', 'salt', 'pepper', 'garlic powder', "lawry's seasoned salt", 'all-purpose flour', 'olive oil', 'butter', 'cream of celery soup', 'sour cream', 'water', 'chicken bouillon cubes', 'yellow onions', 'green peppers']
node.step_1: preheat oven to 325 degrees
node.step_2: rinse pork chops and pat dry with a paper towel
node.step_3: sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper
node.step_4: heat oil and butter in a large frying pan over medium heat
node.step_5: mix together flour , seasoned salt and garlic powder in a pie dish
node.step_6: dredge pork chops in flour mixture and brown both sides in oil mixture
node.step_7: remove chops from pan when browned and crisp
node.step_8: pour out oil from pan and heat water and bouillon cubes until dissolved
node.step_9: add soup and sour cream to the pan and heat through , adding salt and pepper to taste
node.step_10: pour 1 / 4 mixture of sauce into a 9x13 pan and spread around
node.step_11: place chops in pan and top with onions and peppers
node.step_12: sprinkle more salt and pepper over chops , then cover with remaining sauce
node.step_13: cover with tin foil and bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes
node.step_14: add more water to pan if needed to thin sauce and back at 350 degrees for another 15 minutes
node.step_15: serve over egg noodles or white rice

node.description: another recipe from my mother. it's quite rich and tasty. the prep times are a guess, i've never made the cake myself, just enjoyed it. my mother has given me all of her recipe cards, she can no longer bake, i hope that i have not missed something in the translation, if so, please feel free to email me! i am so not a baker, so if something doesn't look right, i probably won't pick up on it!
node.ingredients: ['sugar', 'eggs', 'vegetable oil', 'cinnamon', 'unbleached flour', 'baking powder', 'baking soda', 'salt', 'carrots', 'crushed pineapple', 'cream cheese', 'unsalted butter', 'vanilla extract', 'powdered sugar']
node.step_1: preheat oven to 350 degrees

node.step_4: sift together the next 4 ingredients
node.step_5: slowly add the sifted ingredients to the creamed mixture
node.step_6: when well incorporated , add the crushed pineapple and grated carrots
node.step_7: mix and blend together well
node.step_8: bake for 35-40 minutes or until knife comes away clean from center of cake
node.step_9: while cake is baking , prepare the frosting
node.step_10: cream together the first 3 ingredients
node.step_11: slowly incorporate the powdered sugar until you reach a frosting of nice consistency
node.step_12: when cake is done , let it cool
node.step_13: remove from pan and continue to let it cool completely on a wire rack
node.step_14: when cake has completely cooled , frost it

node.name: grandma shannon s amazing spaghetti sauce
node.steps: ['in a large pot , over medium-high heat , add the olive oil and saute the onion , garlic and meat together', 'saute for 8-10 minutes altogether', 'drain the fat', 'add the remaining ingredients and let simmer for 1 hour or more', 'taste and adjust seasonings to your liking', 'i sometimes add a teaspoon of sugar to make it a bit sweeter , if need be', 'serve over your favorite cooked pasta and enjoy !']
node.description: be sure to make a triple batch of this sauce... it is tried and true and been around for generations. my 90 year-old croatian grandmother still makes this every wednesday night for the family... absolutely and perfectly delicious, with just the right blend of savory and slightly sweet. serve with green salad and homemade french or italian bread. yum!

node.step_3: drain the fat
node.step_4: add the remaining ingredients and let simmer for 1 hour or more
node.step_5: taste and adjust seasonings to your liking
node.step_6: i sometimes add a teaspoon of sugar to make it a bit sweeter , if need be
node.step_7: serve over your favorite cooked pasta and enjoy !

node.description: potato candy is a treasured memory of christmas past. grandma shufelt, and then aunt claris made this rich treat only once each year. was dad ever surprised when i made it for him after my aunt passed. i'm the only family member who thought to ask for this 'secret' recipe.

node.description: when my dh was young his best friend was keith. keith's 'grandma weeks' was always whipping up wonderful dishes for the neighborhood children to enjoy. keith asked for and preserved this recipe from 'grandma weeks' before she passed. i made it two years ago and it really is very easy...and very rich. i could only have a small piece which was fine with dh because he ate the rest!

node.steps: ['prepare biscuits and have them baking in oven', 'in a deep sauce pan melt the butter and whisk in flour to make a roux', 'when your butter / flour mixture has cooked for a few minutes begin to add the milk slowly , whisking frequently to ensure a smooth white sauce', 'add salt and pepper', 'bring to an "almost" boil , while continuing to whisk', 'once you reach this point turn your heat back down to low', 'add tuna , peas , and pimentos and lightly stir to combine ingredients throughout the sauce', 'here is where you would add your cream cheese to your sauce if you are using it', 'cook on low to medium low heat until heated thorougly , stirring occasionally', 'just before biscuits are done slice your hard boiled eggs and add to your creamed tuna', 'give the sauce one last stir and then serve over hot biscuits']
node.description: pure comfort food at its best!! recently i stumbled across a box of my grandparents belongings and this is one of the treasures i rediscovered. this meal is like a warm hug from my grandma! delicious and easy, easy, easy!!
node.ingredients: ['flour', 'butter', 'milk', 'salt', 'black pepper', 'albacore tuna', 'hard-boiled eggs', 'diced pimentos', 'frozen baby peas', 'cream cheese', 'biscuits']
node.step_1: prepare biscuits and have them baking in oven
node.step_2: in a deep sauce pan melt the butter and whisk in flour to make a roux
node.step_3: when your butter / flour mixture has cooked for a few minutes begin to add the milk slowly , whisking frequently to ensure a smooth white sauce
node.step_4: add salt and pepper
node.step_5: bring to an "almost" boil , while continuing to whisk
node.step_6: once you reach this point turn your heat back down to low
node.step_7: add tuna , peas , and pimentos and lightly stir to combine ingredients throughout the sauce
node.step_8: here is where you would add your cream cheese to your sauce if you are using it
node.step_9: cook on low to medium low heat until heated thorougly , stirring occasionally
node.step_10: just before biscuits are done slice your hard boiled eggs and add to your creamed tuna
node.step_11: give the sauce one last stir and then serve over hot biscuits

node.name: grandma s honey cake non dairy
node.steps: ['preheat oven to 150c', 'line a 31 cm x 21 cm tin with baking paper', 'in a large mixing bowl , beat the egg whites , gradually adding sugar until the mixture is very thick', 'in a small mixing bowl , beat egg yolks until pale and creamy', 'add honey and oil , and mix until combined', 'fold the honey mixture into the egg whites', 'add chopped walnuts and flour', 'in a tablespoon , combine baking soda with vinegar and add to mixing bowl', 'beat on high speed until well combined', 'pour into prepared tin and bake for 50 min , or until a skewer inserted in to the centre comes out clean', 'cool cake in tin', 'to serve , slice into diamond-shaped slices and arrange on a platter']
node.description: my grandmother's original recipe from the ukraine. this light, fluffy cake is delicious, healthy and smells heavenly. it also makes the ideal lunchbox treat. keeps well at room temperature, but chances are, it will disappear before you can even think about storing it!
node.ingredients: ['eggs', 'sugar', 'honey', 'olive oil', 'walnuts', 'plain flour', 'baking soda', 'white vinegar']
node.step_1: preheat oven to 150c
node.step_2: line a 31 cm x 21 cm tin with baking paper
node.step_3: in a large mixing bowl , beat the egg whites , gradually adding sugar until the mixture is very thick
node.step_4: in a small mixing bowl , beat egg yolks until pale and creamy
node.step_5: add honey and oil , and mix until combined
node.step_6: fold the honey mixture into the egg whites
node.step_7: add chopped walnuts and flour
node.step_8: in a tablespoon , combine baking soda with vinegar and add to mixing bowl
node.step_9: beat on high speed until well combined
node.step_10: pour into prepared tin and bake for 50 min , or until a skewer inserted in to the centre comes out clean
node.step_11: cool cake in tin
node.step_12: to serve , slice into diamond-shaped slices and arrange on a platter

node.name: grandma s hush puppies
node.steps: ['pour vegetable oil into the fryer of your choice', 'allow it to be getting hot while mixing', 'mix the first five ingredients together in a large bowl', 'add the last four ingredients and mix well', "if the batter isn't the consistency of pancake batter , add a little more flour to thicken or a little more milk for thinning", 'take a metal spoon and dip into the hot grease', 'this allows the batter to just slide off into the grease after putting on spoon', 'now , take about 1 tbs', 'size spoonfuls and place into grease', 'allow to cook for about 5 minute or until golden brown and turn', 'let cook on other side for about 3 more minute', 'remove from grease and drain on paper towel lined plate', 'enjoy with fried fish and cole slaw']
node.description: my grandparent's used to have a fish fry at their house about once a month. grandma always put the hush puppy batter together while grandpa sat on the back porch and fried them with the fish in his big frying cooker. you just can't have a fish fry without these wonderful hush puppies. this recipe makes about 15-20 hush puppies.
node.ingredients: ['yellow cornmeal', 'all-purpose flour', 'sugar', 'baking powder', 'salt', 'milk', 'egg', 'creamed corn', 'onion']
node.step_1: pour vegetable oil into the fryer of your choice
node.step_2: allow it to be getting hot while mixing
node.step_3: mix the first five ingredients together in a large bowl
node.step_4: add the last four ingredients and mix well
node.step_5: if the batter isn't the consistency of pancake batter , add a little more flour to thicken or a little more milk for thinning
node.step_6: take a metal spoon and dip into the hot grease
node.step_7: this allows the batter to just slide off into the grease after putting on spoon
node.step_8: now , take about 1 tbs
node.step_9: size spoonfuls and place into grease
node.step_10: allow to cook for about 5 minute or until golden brown and turn
node.step_11: let cook on other side for about 3 more minute
node.step_12: remove from grease and drain on paper towel lined plate
node.step_13: enjoy with fried fish and cole slaw

node.name: grandma s kolacky cookies
node.steps: ['cut butter into flour with two forks to resemble small peas , as you would pie crust', 'stir in sour cream with serving spoon and mix well', 'form into 2 balls and store , covered , in refrigerator to chill', 'taking out one ball at a time , dust each with flour and roll on floured surface to approximately 1 / 8 thickness', 'cut with larger round cookie cutter or coffee cup , fill center with approximately 1-2 teaspoons solo , bring up each side and pinch to close', 'bake at 350 dg', 'for 12-15 minutes , until bottiom of cookie is just beginning to brown', 'cool on wire racks then dust with powdered sugar', 'enjoy !']
node.description: a cookie recipe given to me by my husband's polish grandma (busia) that i have to double because they fly off the plate -- one recipe for them and one for me! my favorite solo filling is apricot, but any are wonderful.the pronounciation is "kolatchkie", but i've never seen it spelled any other way than kolacky! (dough can be refrigerated and cookies frozen after making.)
node.ingredients: ['flour', 'butter', 'sour cream', 'solo brand filling', "confectioners' sugar"]
node.step_1: cut butter into flour with two forks to resemble small peas , as you would pie crust
node.step_2: stir in sour cream with serving spoon and mix well
node.step_3: form into 2 balls and store , covered , in refrigerator to chill
node.step_4: taking out one ball at a time , dust each with flour and roll on floured surface to approximately 1 / 8 thickness
node.step_5: cut with larger round cookie cutter or coffee cup , fill center with approximately 1-2 teaspoons solo , bring up each side and pinch to close
node.step_6: bake at 350 dg
node.step_7: for 12-15 minutes , until bottiom of cookie is just beginning to brown
node.step_8: cool on wire racks then dust with powdered sugar
node.step_9: enjoy !

node.name: grandma s old fashioned oatmeal cookies
node.steps: ['heat oven to 350f - you will need 3 baking sheets lined with parchment paper', 'whisk together flour , baking powder , soda and salt', 'beat together with mixer at low speed - butter and sugar until the sugar granules are not visible', 'increase speed and beat 1 minute longer , scrape sides as needed and add egg , beat another 30 seconds', 'add flour mixture 1 / 3 at a time and incorporate well over med speed until mixture is smooth', 'add oatmeal and stir into the dough using your rubber spatula', 'divide into 24 equal portions and bake for 13 to 16 minutes placing only one cookie sheet in the oven at a time and rotating the cookie sheet half way through your cooking time -- these are the best and the thinnest cookies and very crispy']
node.description: i have the pleasure of reading and translating my gran's recipes - written in german some of them are difficult to translate - and then to take them from the era of lard and bacon grease to a healthier you - well here's one that came out great !! enjoy...
node.ingredients: ['unbleached flour', 'baking powder', 'baking soda', 'unsalted butter', 'granulated sugar', 'light brown sugar', 'egg', 'vanilla', 'old fashioned oats']
node.step_1: heat oven to 350f - you will need 3 baking sheets lined with parchment paper
node.step_2: whisk together flour , baking powder , soda and salt
node.step_3: beat together with mixer at low speed - butter and sugar until the sugar granules are not visible
node.step_4: increase speed and beat 1 minute longer , scrape sides as needed and add egg , beat another 30 seconds
node.step_5: add flour mixture 1 / 3 at a time and incorporate well over med speed until mixture is smooth
node.step_6: add oatmeal and stir into the dough using your rubber spatula
node.step_7: divide into 24 equal portions and bake for 13 to 16 minutes placing only one cookie sheet in the oven at a time and rotating the cookie sheet half way through your cooking time -- these are the best and the thinnest cookies and very crispy

node.description: another recipe from the 1980 version of the grace evangelical congregational church cookbook from muir, pennsylvania that was given to me by my nana when i became an adult. this was submitted to the cookbook by my late grandfather - william parker.
node.ingredients: ['butter', 'onions', 'beef bouillon', 'salt and pepper', 'worcestershire sauce', 'french bread', 'parmesan cheese']
node.step_1: heat butter and then add onion and simmer for 10 minutes
node.step_2: add bouillon and bring to boil and then simmer for 20 minutes
node.step_3: season to your taste with salt , pepper and worcestershire sauce
node.step_4: pour the hot soup into earthenware cups
node.step_5: on top of each , float a slice of sauteed french bread and sprinkle with grated cheese

node.name: grandpa s french toast
node.steps: ['on the stovetop , turn on to medium heat and use a griddle', 'in a bowl big enough to dunk your bread , add the 3 egg yolks and 1 whole egg and 1 / 4 cup of milk and with a fork , stir these ingredients', 'add the vanilla and cinnamon', 'when the griddle gets warm , quickly , put in your slices of bread in the mixture , both sides', 'if you let it soak , the bread will fall apart', 'wait until the bread is a golden brown and flip to cook the other side', 'serve with butter and maple sryup or for a little less fat , sprinkle with powered sugar and add some strawberries', 'i have cooked this alot in my life , and after trial and error , i have decided that if you add 4 whole eggs , you are just cooking eggs on a slice of bread , but you need something to keep everything together , so you need a little something like the egg whites to do that', 'see what you think']
node.description: my grandpa made this for us when we would stay all night. i watched him from start to finish and this is what i came up with.
node.ingredients: ['wheat toast', 'egg yolks', 'egg', 'milk', 'vanilla extract', 'cinnamon']
node.step_1: on the stovetop , turn on to medium heat and use a griddle
node.step_2: in a bowl big enough to dunk your bread , add the 3 egg yolks and 1 whole egg and 1 / 4 cup of milk and with a fork , stir these ingredients
node.step_3: add the vanilla and cinnamon
node.step_4: when the griddle gets warm , quickly , put in your slices of bread in the mixture , both sides
node.step_5: if you let it soak , the bread will fall apart
node.step_6: wait until the bread is a golden brown and flip to cook the other side
node.step_7: serve with butter and maple sryup or for a little less fat , sprinkle with powered sugar and add some strawberries
node.step_8: i have cooked this alot in my life , and after trial and error , i have decided that if you add 4 whole eggs , you are just cooking eggs on a slice of bread , but you need something to keep everything together , so you need a little something like the egg whites to do that
node.step_9: see what you think

node.step_3: simmer for about 10 minutes
node.step_4: add minced garlic and simmer 2 more minutes
node.step_5: add next 3 ingredients
node.step_6: combine with the sauerkraut , kielbasa and potatoes
node.step_7: bring to a simmer on the stove top

node.name: grandpa s strawberry lemonade
node.steps: ['in a medium saucepan , bring the water and sugar to a boil', 'reduce the heat and simmer , stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves', 'add lemon peel and lemon juice , stir and remove from heat', 'let cool completely , then strain into a clean pitcher', 'in a blender , puree the pint of strawberries and add to the lemon juice', 'stir well and refrigerate', 'add sparkling water and stir well when ready to serve']
node.description: not sure where my dad found this recipe, but it is a perfect poolside treat!
node.ingredients: ['water', 'sugar', 'lemon peel', 'fresh lemon juice', 'fresh strawberries', 'sparkling water', 'ice', 'strawberry']
node.step_1: in a medium saucepan , bring the water and sugar to a boil
node.step_2: reduce the heat and simmer , stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves
node.step_3: add lemon peel and lemon juice , stir and remove from heat
node.step_4: let cool completely , then strain into a clean pitcher
node.step_5: in a blender , puree the pint of strawberries and add to the lemon juice
node.step_6: stir well and refrigerate
node.step_7: add sparkling water and stir well when ready to serve

node.name: grandparent mocktails 3 4 and 5 non alcoholic
node.steps: ['little manhattan: place all ingredients in a shaker w / ice & shake well', 'strain into a well-chilled glass & garnish w / the cherry', 'creamsicle cooler: fill a chilled tall glass w / ice', 'add orange juice + papaya juice & top w / grenadine', 'pour mixture into a blender , whip till well-blended & garnish w / the cherry', 'monkey jungle juice: mix banana & vanilla ice cream in a blender', 'add vanilla extract , orange juice + milk & puree till thick & smooth', 'serve in a tall well-chilled glass']
node.description: my brother sent me an invite to join him at the grandparents.com website & i get periodic emails from them on the art of grandparenting. the most recent email had a fun article on kid-friendly mocktails & suggested that kids should have spec beverages for their parties & also tasty + festive beverages to enjoy while their elders drink cocktails on spec occasions & holidays. per the intro, shirley temple, take a bow & step aside. some new entertainers have taken center stage. the effervescent, sometimes sparkly, always refreshing & totally non-alcoholic mocktails are beverages that kids & partygoers of all ages will enjoy. i am entering the recipes in pairs, groups or individually based on # of servings. *cheers* !
node.ingredients: ['cranberry juice', 'orange juice', 'cherry juice', 'lemon juice', 'orange bitters', 'maraschino cherry', 'papaya nectar', 'grenadine', 'banana', 'vanilla ice cream', 'vanilla extract', 'milk']
node.step_1: little manhattan: place all ingredients in a shaker w / ice & shake well
node.step_2: strain into a well-chilled glass & garnish w / the cherry
node.step_3: creamsicle cooler: fill a chilled tall glass w / ice
node.step_4: add orange juice + papaya juice & top w / grenadine
node.step_5: pour mixture into a blender , whip till well-blended & garnish w / the cherry
node.step_6: monkey jungle juice: mix banana & vanilla ice cream in a blender
node.step_7: add vanilla extract , orange juice + milk & puree till thick & smooth
node.step_8: serve in a tall well-chilled glass

node.name: grannies chocolate chip ginger nuts
node.steps: ['preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius , 350 degrees farenhiet or gas mark 4', 'begin by sifting the self raising flour , cocoa , ginger and bicarbonate of soda into a mixing bowl', 'then , using your finger', 'now add the golden syrup , then mix everything with a wooden spoon and finish off by squeezing the mixture together with your hands', 'after that , divide the mixture into 16 , and roll each portion into a ball', 'place on a lined baking sheet , very well spread out as they will spread out when cooking , flatten each ball slightly , then bake on the centre shelf for 15-20 minutes or untill they have spread out and turned cracked and craggy', 'cool on a baking tray for a few minutes then , using a palette knife , remove to a wire rack to cool completely', 'then enjoy !']
node.description: got to try them!!! everybody loves them!
node.ingredients: ['dark chocolate', 'ground ginger', 'self raising flour', 'cocoa', 'bicarbonate of soda', 'butter', 'granulated sugar', 'golden syrup']
node.step_1: preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius , 350 degrees farenhiet or gas mark 4
node.step_2: begin by sifting the self raising flour , cocoa , ginger and bicarbonate of soda into a mixing bowl
node.step_3: then , using your finger
node.step_4: now add the golden syrup , then mix everything with a wooden spoon and finish off by squeezing the mixture together with your hands
node.step_5: after that , divide the mixture into 16 , and roll each portion into a ball
node.step_6: place on a lined baking sheet , very well spread out as they will spread out when cooking , flatten each ball slightly , then bake on the centre shelf for 15-20 minutes or untill they have spread out and turned cracked and craggy
node.step_7: cool on a baking tray for a few minutes then , using a palette knife , remove to a wire rack to cool completely
node.step_8: then enjoy !

node.name: granny smith apple cheddar scones
node.steps: ['heat oven to 400 degrees , lightly coat a large baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray', 'combine flour , 1 / 2 cup of the sugar , baking powder , baking soda , salt , and nutmag in a large bowl', 'add butter', 'cut in with a pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs', 'with a fork stir in buttermilk , apple , and cheddar cheese pieces just until mixture froms a dough', 'turn dough out onto floured surface , knead 6 or 7 times', 'divide dough in half and gather each into a ball', 'pat each portion into a 6 to-inch-circle', 'using a sharp knife coated with nonstick cooking spray , cut each round into 6-equal-wedges', 'brush with egg white', 'sprinkle with 2 teaspoons sugar', 'bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and no longer soft in center', 'with a serrated knife , cut through earlier wedge markes', 'remove to rack to cool', 'serve warm or at room temperature']
node.description: what could be better than warm scones for breakfast or brunch. the recipe comes from family circle magazine.
node.ingredients: ['flour', 'sugar', 'baking powder', 'baking soda', 'salt', 'ground nutmeg', 'butter', 'buttermilk', 'granny smith apple', 'sharp cheddar cheese', 'egg white']
node.step_1: heat oven to 400 degrees , lightly coat a large baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray
node.step_2: combine flour , 1 / 2 cup of the sugar , baking powder , baking soda , salt , and nutmag in a large bowl
node.step_3: add butter
node.step_4: cut in with a pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs
node.step_5: with a fork stir in buttermilk , apple , and cheddar cheese pieces just until mixture froms a dough
node.step_6: turn dough out onto floured surface , knead 6 or 7 times
node.step_7: divide dough in half and gather each into a ball
node.step_8: pat each portion into a 6 to-inch-circle
node.step_9: using a sharp knife coated with nonstick cooking spray , cut each round into 6-equal-wedges
node.step_10: brush with egg white
node.step_11: sprinkle with 2 teaspoons sugar
node.step_12: bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and no longer soft in center
node.step_13: with a serrated knife , cut through earlier wedge markes
node.step_14: remove to rack to cool
node.step_15: serve warm or at room temperature

node.step_2: beat in the egg and molasses
node.step_3: combine the flour , baking soda , ginger , cinnamon , and salt
node.step_4: gradually add to the creamed mixture
node.step_5: roll teaspoonfuls of dough into balls
node.step_6: dip one side of each ball into sugar
node.step_7: place with sugar side up on a greased baking sheet

node.step_3: in a small bowl , mix corn syrup , oil and vanilla extract
node.step_4: pour oil mix into oat mix , make sure oats are evenly coated
node.step_5: divide mixture evenly between two jelly roll pans

node.name: granola breakfast bread
node.steps: ['put 1 / 2 cup warm water in a mixing bowl', 'sprinkle the yeast over , stir , and let stand to dissolve for 5 minutes', 'add the 2 cups warm water , dry milk , and butter , and stir to blend', 'beat in the salt , cornmea , and whole wheat flour and mix until smooth', 'add 2 cups all purpose flour and beat until well mixed', 'beat in as much more flour as is needed to make a manageable dough', 'add the granola', 'turn the dough onto a floured board , or use dough hook on electric mixer and knead for a minute', 'let the dough rest for 10 minutes', 'resume kneading until the dough is elastic , about 5 more minutes', 'put the dough in a greased bowl and turn to coat all sides', 'cover and let rise to double its bulk', 'punch the dough down and divide in half', 'put the dough in two greased 8 1 / 2 x 4 1 / 2 x 3-inch loaf pans', 'let rise to the tops of the pans', 'bake in a preheated 350 oven for 45 minutes , and until lightly browned and done', 'cool on racks']
node.description: from "the breakfast book"
node.ingredients: ['warm water', 'dry yeast', 'dry milk', 'butter', 'salt', 'cornmeal', 'whole wheat bread flour', 'all-purpose flour', 'granola cereal']
node.step_1: put 1 / 2 cup warm water in a mixing bowl
node.step_2: sprinkle the yeast over , stir , and let stand to dissolve for 5 minutes
node.step_3: add the 2 cups warm water , dry milk , and butter , and stir to blend
node.step_4: beat in the salt , cornmea , and whole wheat flour and mix until smooth
node.step_5: add 2 cups all purpose flour and beat until well mixed
node.step_6: beat in as much more flour as is needed to make a manageable dough
node.step_7: add the granola
node.step_8: turn the dough onto a floured board , or use dough hook on electric mixer and knead for a minute
node.step_9: let the dough rest for 10 minutes
node.step_10: resume kneading until the dough is elastic , about 5 more minutes
node.step_11: put the dough in a greased bowl and turn to coat all sides
node.step_12: cover and let rise to double its bulk
node.step_13: punch the dough down and divide in half
node.step_14: put the dough in two greased 8 1 / 2 x 4 1 / 2 x 3-inch loaf pans
node.step_15: let rise to the tops of the pans
node.step_16: bake in a preheated 350 oven for 45 minutes , and until lightly browned and done
node.step_17: cool on racks

node.description: i used to have a lot of fun making this with my kids, but now they make it on their own, which is even more fun for me!

node.step_2: stir well
node.step_3: spread mixture evenly in a 15- x 10- x 1-inch jellyroll pan
node.step_4: pour margarine over granola mixture
node.step_5: bake , uncovered , at 350 degrees f
node.step_6: for 15 minutes , stirring every 5 minutes
node.step_7: let cool
node.step_8: stir in raisins , banana chips , apple chips , and chocolate chips

node.name: granola nut protein bar
node.steps: ['in a double boiler , warm the peanut butter and honey to a smooth consistency', 'this step can be done in the microwave as well--just heat both ingredients for 70 to 90 seconds', 'in a mixing bowl , stir together all remaining dry ingredients', 'pour in the peanut-butter mixture and stir until completely combined', 'spread uniformly into a brownie pan', 'slice into 12 to 16 pieces , then wrap each piece in plastic wrap', 'refrigerate or freeze before cutting if mixture does not seem to be hard enough', 'each granola nut protein bar costs 25 to 35 cents to make , as opposed to 99 cents and up for store-bought energy bars', "on top of that , if you do use organic ingredients , you won't believe the difference !"]
node.description: forget spending money on all those meal replacement bars that have a bad after taste. make your own with this great recipe. i found it online somewhere. these are great to eat before a hard workout. each bar has around 200 calories. i don't recommend this one for weight loss because it does have a higher fat content. if you are trying to lose weight check out some of my other meal replacement bar recipes.
node.ingredients: ['natural-style peanut butter', 'honey', 'protein powder', 'oatmeal', 'raisins', 'wheat bran']
node.step_1: in a double boiler , warm the peanut butter and honey to a smooth consistency
node.step_2: this step can be done in the microwave as well--just heat both ingredients for 70 to 90 seconds
node.step_3: in a mixing bowl , stir together all remaining dry ingredients
node.step_4: pour in the peanut-butter mixture and stir until completely combined
node.step_5: spread uniformly into a brownie pan
node.step_6: slice into 12 to 16 pieces , then wrap each piece in plastic wrap
node.step_7: refrigerate or freeze before cutting if mixture does not seem to be hard enough
node.step_8: each granola nut protein bar costs 25 to 35 cents to make , as opposed to 99 cents and up for store-bought energy bars
node.step_9: on top of that , if you do use organic ingredients , you won't believe the difference !

node.name: grape jelly
node.steps: ['first make the grape juice using clean washed grapes', 'to 3 1 / 2 pounds of clean grapes add 1 1 / 2 cups water', 'bring to a boil and simmer covered for 10 minutes', 'strain and squeeze out all of the juice with a jelly cloth , or whatever means you have', 'in a very big pan , put 5 cups of the juice', 'add the fruit pectin to the juice', 'mix well', 'on high heat , bring to a full rolling boil , and boil hard for 1 minute , stirring constantly', 'stir in sugar all at once , and bring back to a full rolling boil , again boil hard for 1 minute stirring constantly', 'remove from heat , skim off foam and pour into hot jars', 'if using paraffin , pour hot paraffin in on top of jelly', 'or seal with canning lids']
node.description: grape jelly is my favorite. my husband makes this for me. he makes blackberry, plum and crab apple too. he is an excellent cook. he is the canner in our family--he cans everything!! the cooking time is only after it comes to a boil.
node.ingredients: ['grape juice', 'pectin', 'sugar']
node.step_1: first make the grape juice using clean washed grapes
node.step_2: to 3 1 / 2 pounds of clean grapes add 1 1 / 2 cups water
node.step_3: bring to a boil and simmer covered for 10 minutes
node.step_4: strain and squeeze out all of the juice with a jelly cloth , or whatever means you have
node.step_5: in a very big pan , put 5 cups of the juice
node.step_6: add the fruit pectin to the juice
node.step_7: mix well
node.step_8: on high heat , bring to a full rolling boil , and boil hard for 1 minute , stirring constantly
node.step_9: stir in sugar all at once , and bring back to a full rolling boil , again boil hard for 1 minute stirring constantly
node.step_10: remove from heat , skim off foam and pour into hot jars
node.step_11: if using paraffin , pour hot paraffin in on top of jelly
node.step_12: or seal with canning lids

node.step_2: start by placing the olive sauce ingredients into a bowl and set aside
node.step_3: place pasta into a large pot of boiling salted water
node.step_4: when pasta is about 3-4 minutes from done , melt the olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium-high heat and brown the garlic
node.step_5: add the olive sauce and let it simmer until pasta is ready
node.step_6: drain pasta well , return it to the pot and stir in 2 / 3 of the sauce

node.name: grecian salad dressing
node.steps: ['in a very large container , mix together the olive oil , garlic powder , oregano , basil , pepper , salt , onion powder , and dijon-style mustard', 'pour in the vinegar , and mix vigorously until well blended', 'store tightly covered at room temperature']
node.description: i first found this recipe on allrecipes quite sometime ago and it has become a staple in our house. this makes a lot of dressing but in our house it goes quite quickly. if you find the vinegar a bit strong, you may want to scale it back to 1 1/2 quarts. great for greek salads or any kind of dinner salad. we also use this as a topping for fresh tomatoes in the summertime.

node.step_2: pour in the vinegar , and mix vigorously until well blended
node.step_3: store tightly covered at room temperature

node.step_2: arrange pita wedges in a single layer on a cookie sheet and brush or drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil

node.step_7: blend or process until smooth

node.name: greek almond honey cake
node.steps: ['make the syrup first: bring 1 1 / 2 cups honey and 1 1 / 2 cups orange juice to a boil in a saucepan', 'reduce heat and simmer for 5 min', 'skim surface of syrup for any froth that may form', 'allow syrup to cool', 'for cake: preheat oven to 350f', 'butter a 9 x 13 inch baking dish well', 'sift together almond flour and baking soda', 'beat egg whites with cream of tartar until you have a stiff meringue', 'combine egg yolks , honey , yoghurt , almonds , orange juice concentrate , and orange zest', 'stir into dry ingredients', 'gently fold in 1 / 4 of meringue mixture to lighten almond batter , and then fold in the rest', 'it is ok to have a few white streaks', 'pour batter into baking pan', 'scatter blanched , slivered almonds over top', 'bake until top is golden , about 45 minutes , or until cake tester comes out clean', 'pour syrup over hot cake', 'poke cake gently with a toothpick to help cake absorb syrup', 'serve when cake is cool and syrup has been absorbed', 'this cake is great served with a dollop of very lightly-sweetened whipped cream']
node.description: a traditional honey cake using almond meal instead of flour or semolina. like many greek cakes, it is further enriched by a honey syrup, making it very rich. greeks don't have a dessert like this after a meal - that would be too much of a good thing. rather, we would have it with a cup of coffee in the early evening, after our afternoon siesta.
node.ingredients: ['almond flour', 'eggs', 'cream of tartar', 'baking soda', 'honey', 'yoghurt', 'blanched almond', 'frozen orange juice concentrate', 'orange zest', 'butter', 'blanched slivered almond', 'orange juice']
node.step_1: make the syrup first: bring 1 1 / 2 cups honey and 1 1 / 2 cups orange juice to a boil in a saucepan
node.step_2: reduce heat and simmer for 5 min
node.step_3: skim surface of syrup for any froth that may form
node.step_4: allow syrup to cool
node.step_5: for cake: preheat oven to 350f
node.step_6: butter a 9 x 13 inch baking dish well
node.step_7: sift together almond flour and baking soda
node.step_8: beat egg whites with cream of tartar until you have a stiff meringue
node.step_9: combine egg yolks , honey , yoghurt , almonds , orange juice concentrate , and orange zest
node.step_10: stir into dry ingredients
node.step_11: gently fold in 1 / 4 of meringue mixture to lighten almond batter , and then fold in the rest
node.step_12: it is ok to have a few white streaks
node.step_13: pour batter into baking pan
node.step_14: scatter blanched , slivered almonds over top
node.step_15: bake until top is golden , about 45 minutes , or until cake tester comes out clean
node.step_16: pour syrup over hot cake
node.step_17: poke cake gently with a toothpick to help cake absorb syrup
node.step_18: serve when cake is cool and syrup has been absorbed
node.step_19: this cake is great served with a dollop of very lightly-sweetened whipped cream

node.name: greek baked chicken thighs

node.description: baked chicken thighs with an array of tomatoes and squashed potatoes. found this recipe online, made it for dinner and spruced it up a little. the tomatoes are blanched and peeled, but that step can be skipped if you're in a hurry.

node.step_1: after you bone your chicken thighs and cut them into smaller pieces , season them with salt and pepper and brown them in olive oil
node.step_2: reserve in the roasting pan
node.step_3: boil your potatoes in salted water until cooked and then slightly squish each potato and add to the pan with the chicken
node.step_4: prick one end of your tomatoes and drop them in boiling water for about 45 seconds
node.step_5: remove the tomatoes from the water and place in another pot with ice and cold water
node.step_6: now gently pinch each tomato and the skins will easily come off
node.step_7: discard the skins and add the tomatoes into the roasting pan
node.step_8: drizzle with oilve oil , add the garlic , lemon juice , oregano and rosemary and some additional salt and pepper
node.step_9: give the ingredients a gentle toss and place in a pre-heated 375f oven for 40 minutes

node.description: a creamy, spicy dip to be served with pita bread or crackers, or as a side dish with meat or fish. you could also use it to dip veggies. adapted from authentic greek recipes blog
node.ingredients: ['eggplants', 'greek yogurt', 'garlic cloves', 'olive oil', 'lemon', 'salt']

node.step_3: you want the skin to be burned to give the dip a smoky flavor
node.step_4: allow the eggplants to cool and cut them open and scoop out the flesh
node.step_5: discard the large dark seeds
node.step_6: place the flesh in a colander and salt it , and add the lemon juice
node.step_7: allow the flesh to drain for about one hour
node.step_8: place the drained flesh in a bowl and mash with a fork

node.step_10: enjoy !

node.description: i used to get these fries at cheap little greek restaurants. when i moved, however, no place served them anymore. so i started experimenting and found it was quite easy to make them on my own. these are a simple and delicious way to do fries.

node.name: greek galaktoboureko
node.steps: ['to make the syrup , place all syrup ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil', 'cook for 10 minutes , skimming off any foam', 'remove from heat and cool', 'to prepare the custard , place milk and sugar in a small saucepan and heat until very hot', 'stir in cream of wheat , then add butter and salt', 'cook until thickened and smooth , stirring constantly , then remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature', 'beat together eggs and vanilla in a large bowl until light and fluffy', 'stir in cooled custard and mix thoroughly', 'preheat oven to 350 degrees f', 'to prepare pastry , grease an 11x17-inch baking pan with butter', 'unwrap phyllo , laying out flat , and covering with damp towels when not getting pastry', 'lay 1 sheet of phyllo across the baking sheet and brush with butter', 'repeat with more sheet of phyllo to make an 8-sheet layer', 'pour the custard on top of the 8 buttered sheets and spread it out evenly with a spatula', 'repeat the process of the phyllo , covering the custard with 8 more buttered sheets', 'when you have those done , take a sharp knife a punch some breathing holes in the top', 'place the galaktoboureko in a preheated oven and bake for 45-60 min , or until custard is set and the pastry shakes loose from the edges of the pan', 'allow the galaktaboureko to cool about 30 minutes , thenpour the syrup evenly over the pastry', 'allow it to cool completely before cutting and serving', 'serves up to 48 , depending on size']
node.description: this is my husband's favorite greek dessert. it is like a baklava, except there is custard inside, all nice and ewwy-gooey. he gets all ewwy-gooey, too when he has this.
node.ingredients: ['sugar', 'water', 'orange rind', 'orange flower water', 'orange juice', 'milk', 'cream of wheat', 'unsalted butter', 'eggs', 'vanilla', 'salt', 'phyllo dough']
node.step_1: to make the syrup , place all syrup ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil
node.step_2: cook for 10 minutes , skimming off any foam
node.step_3: remove from heat and cool
node.step_4: to prepare the custard , place milk and sugar in a small saucepan and heat until very hot
node.step_5: stir in cream of wheat , then add butter and salt
node.step_6: cook until thickened and smooth , stirring constantly , then remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature
node.step_7: beat together eggs and vanilla in a large bowl until light and fluffy
node.step_8: stir in cooled custard and mix thoroughly
node.step_9: preheat oven to 350 degrees f
node.step_10: to prepare pastry , grease an 11x17-inch baking pan with butter
node.step_11: unwrap phyllo , laying out flat , and covering with damp towels when not getting pastry
node.step_12: lay 1 sheet of phyllo across the baking sheet and brush with butter
node.step_13: repeat with more sheet of phyllo to make an 8-sheet layer
node.step_14: pour the custard on top of the 8 buttered sheets and spread it out evenly with a spatula
node.step_15: repeat the process of the phyllo , covering the custard with 8 more buttered sheets
node.step_16: when you have those done , take a sharp knife a punch some breathing holes in the top
node.step_17: place the galaktoboureko in a preheated oven and bake for 45-60 min , or until custard is set and the pastry shakes loose from the edges of the pan
node.step_18: allow the galaktaboureko to cool about 30 minutes , thenpour the syrup evenly over the pastry
node.step_19: allow it to cool completely before cutting and serving
node.step_20: serves up to 48 , depending on size

node.name: greek goddess pizza
node.steps: ['preheat oven to 400f', 'combine olive oil and italian seasoning and brush onto crust , using most of the seasoning on the outer rim for a crispy crust', 'add pizza sauce and spread evenly , leaving a 2 / 3 inch crust around the rim', 'layer in this order: 1 / 4 cup feta cheese , 3 / 4 cup mozzarella cheese , kalamata olives , artichokes , tomatoes , 1 / 4 cup feta cheese , 1 / 4 cup mozzarella', 'cook for 15 minutes or until crust is golden brown']
node.description: feta cheese, kalamata olives, artichokes, and tomatoes top this gourmet pizza. this is my signature pizza recipe that i make every week. i experimented with flavors for a while until i eventually got it right. i love this recipe and i hope you do too!
node.ingredients: ['pizza crust', 'olive oil', 'italian seasoning', 'pizza sauce', 'mozzarella cheese', 'feta cheese', 'kalamata olives', 'artichoke hearts', 'cherry tomatoes']
node.step_1: preheat oven to 400f
node.step_2: combine olive oil and italian seasoning and brush onto crust , using most of the seasoning on the outer rim for a crispy crust
node.step_3: add pizza sauce and spread evenly , leaving a 2 / 3 inch crust around the rim
node.step_4: layer in this order: 1 / 4 cup feta cheese , 3 / 4 cup mozzarella cheese , kalamata olives , artichokes , tomatoes , 1 / 4 cup feta cheese , 1 / 4 cup mozzarella
node.step_5: cook for 15 minutes or until crust is golden brown

node.name: greek lamb baked in clay pots
node.steps: ['for the dough:', 'i double or triple the recipe depending on how many clay bowls i need to cover', 'place flour in a bowl and mix in salt and sugar', 'make a well in the center and add water', 'mix together until dough is formed', 'knead for 3-5 minutes', 'cover and set aside until ready to use', 'when ready , roll out dough on floured surface', 'make sure the dough is large enough to cover the opening of the clay dish with at least 2 inches over hang', 'i divide the dough into the number of bowls i need to cover and roll out each separately', 'for the filling:', 'in a large bowl mix all ingredients except feta', 'transfer to clay pot and top with feta', 'gently cover the container and seal around the edge with your finger', 'a little water helps', 'place baking dish on lowest rack in cold oven and turn heat to 275', 'bake for 3 1 / 2 to 4 hours', 'turn off oven , open door , and allow to cool for at least 20 minutes before removing', 'serve hot']
node.description: this method of roasting meat in clay pots or water jugs was used by women during the greek war of independance to surreptitously bake and bring food to their soliders in the mountains. any clay or earthen cookware will do. i use individual serving size clay bowls.
node.ingredients: ['flour', 'water', 'salt', 'sugar', 'lamb', 'onions', 'potatoes', 'celery', 'pickled jalapeno peppers', 'garlic cloves', 'fresh parsley', 'fresh dill', 'fresh lemon juice', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'dried thyme', 'dried rosemary', 'dried sage', 'black pepper', 'feta cheese']
node.step_1: for the dough:
node.step_2: i double or triple the recipe depending on how many clay bowls i need to cover
node.step_3: place flour in a bowl and mix in salt and sugar
node.step_4: make a well in the center and add water
node.step_5: mix together until dough is formed
node.step_6: knead for 3-5 minutes
node.step_7: cover and set aside until ready to use
node.step_8: when ready , roll out dough on floured surface
node.step_9: make sure the dough is large enough to cover the opening of the clay dish with at least 2 inches over hang
node.step_10: i divide the dough into the number of bowls i need to cover and roll out each separately
node.step_11: for the filling:
node.step_12: in a large bowl mix all ingredients except feta
node.step_13: transfer to clay pot and top with feta
node.step_14: gently cover the container and seal around the edge with your finger
node.step_15: a little water helps
node.step_16: place baking dish on lowest rack in cold oven and turn heat to 275
node.step_17: bake for 3 1 / 2 to 4 hours
node.step_18: turn off oven , open door , and allow to cool for at least 20 minutes before removing
node.step_19: serve hot

node.name: greek lamb chops
node.steps: ['in a large skillet , medium coat lamb chops with the greek seasoning and brown with the olive oil', 'remove chops and add the diced tomatoes , tomato sauce , cinnamon , parsley and the remainder of the greek seasoning', 'stir and saut sauce mixture for approx 10 min on low-med heat uncovered', 'return chops to the center area of pan and spoon on sauce mixture', 'reduce heat to low temp and cover', 'simmer 1 hour stirring periodically', 'remove chops again and add rice and green beans , mixing together well', 'return chops and simmer for another =hour or until meat is very tender and easy to pull from bone', 'enjoy with a nice greek salad !']
node.description: coming from "greek roots" i have been indulging myself for years cooking dishes from the "old world" and creating my own along the way. here is my latest creation, so good and easy to make.
node.ingredients: ['t-bone type lamb chops', 'olive oil', 'tomatoes', 'tomato sauce', 'cavenders all purpose greek seasoning', 'dried parsley', 'cinnamon', 'italian cut green beans', 'instant rice', 'burgundy wine']
node.step_1: in a large skillet , medium coat lamb chops with the greek seasoning and brown with the olive oil
node.step_2: remove chops and add the diced tomatoes , tomato sauce , cinnamon , parsley and the remainder of the greek seasoning
node.step_3: stir and saut sauce mixture for approx 10 min on low-med heat uncovered
node.step_4: return chops to the center area of pan and spoon on sauce mixture
node.step_5: reduce heat to low temp and cover
node.step_6: simmer 1 hour stirring periodically
node.step_7: remove chops again and add rice and green beans , mixing together well
node.step_8: return chops and simmer for another =hour or until meat is very tender and easy to pull from bone
node.step_9: enjoy with a nice greek salad !

node.name: greek lamb rotisserie grill methods
node.steps: ['cut excess fat from leg of lamb', 'combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl or baking dish large enough to accommodate the lamb and mix well', 'message marinade into lamb making sure it is in everywhere', 'cover and refrigerate overnight , turning often', 'remove from refrigerator to allow it to reach room temperature about 30 minutes', 'preheat grill', 're-roll leg into a roast very tightly and tie', 'place lamb on middle of the rotisserie skewer making sure it is balanced and secure', 'reduce temperature to low', 'cook for 2 hours brushing with remaining marinade every 1 / 2 hour', 'when the middle of the meat reaches a temperature of about 145 degrees remove from grill', 'let a leg of lamb rest for 20 minutes before you start carving it up', 'this will even out the temperature , make sure its completely done and allow the juices to flow back into the meat', 'carve the meat , starting from the thick end and work our way down to the shank', 'alternate cooking method:', 'start by grilling the leg over a medium high direct heat to sear the surface', 'this will give the meat a crusty surface and add texture', 'turn every 5 minutes to sear the surface evenly', 'on the rotisserie you wont have to worry about this', 'grill over this direct heat for about 15 minutes then move to indirect grilling and cut the temperature down to a medium heat', 'watch for flare-ups during the direct grilling phase', 'the leg of lamb will need about 20 minutes per pound to cook so plan accordingly']
node.description: this greek-style marinade has strong flavors to complement the strong flavor of lamb. buy a boneless leg that's been butterflied, or rolled and tied. unroll it for the marinade to get in everywhere then re-rolling it for even cooking and tenderness. if you happen to buy it with the netting try to save the netting to replace it after marinating. you can grill this flat on the grill as well. this lamb sliced thin is great to make gyro's with!
node.ingredients: ['leg of lamb', 'lemons, juice and zest of', 'olive oil', 'garlic cloves', 'thyme', 'oregano', 'rosemary', 'bay leaf', 'salt and pepper']
node.step_1: cut excess fat from leg of lamb
node.step_2: combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl or baking dish large enough to accommodate the lamb and mix well
node.step_3: message marinade into lamb making sure it is in everywhere
node.step_4: cover and refrigerate overnight , turning often
node.step_5: remove from refrigerator to allow it to reach room temperature about 30 minutes
node.step_6: preheat grill
node.step_7: re-roll leg into a roast very tightly and tie
node.step_8: place lamb on middle of the rotisserie skewer making sure it is balanced and secure
node.step_9: reduce temperature to low
node.step_10: cook for 2 hours brushing with remaining marinade every 1 / 2 hour
node.step_11: when the middle of the meat reaches a temperature of about 145 degrees remove from grill
node.step_12: let a leg of lamb rest for 20 minutes before you start carving it up
node.step_13: this will even out the temperature , make sure its completely done and allow the juices to flow back into the meat
node.step_14: carve the meat , starting from the thick end and work our way down to the shank
node.step_15: alternate cooking method:
node.step_16: start by grilling the leg over a medium high direct heat to sear the surface
node.step_17: this will give the meat a crusty surface and add texture
node.step_18: turn every 5 minutes to sear the surface evenly
node.step_19: on the rotisserie you wont have to worry about this
node.step_20: grill over this direct heat for about 15 minutes then move to indirect grilling and cut the temperature down to a medium heat
node.step_21: watch for flare-ups during the direct grilling phase
node.step_22: the leg of lamb will need about 20 minutes per pound to cook so plan accordingly

node.name: greek meatballs lemon and lamb are a marriage made in heaven

node.step_1: form the meat mix into small balls and brown over medium heat in the oil , this will help them hold together
node.step_2: add 2 cups of stock to the pan and simmer uncovered for about twenty minutes
node.step_3: strain out the stock into a container
node.step_4: whisk the two egg yolks and one whole egg then , while still whisking , slowly add a quarter cup of lemon juice
node.step_5: then very slowly whisk in the hot stock , careful here we don't want to scramble the eggs
node.step_6: pour the sauce back into the pan with the meatballs and simmer over low heat until the sauce thickens
node.step_7: check for salt
node.step_8: have this with rice and a few lemon wedges
