node.description: if you love greek food then you might want to give this recipe a try, this is not your average everyday salad the zucchini, eggplant and bell peppers are broiled firstly, you may adjust the veggie amounts slightly or double the complete recipe, to save some time you can broil the zucchini and bell pepper and cook the pasta shells up to a day ahead, you may omit the eggplant and use two zucchini if desired
node.ingredients: ['white wine vinegar', 'dijon mustard', 'garlic', 'salt', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'honey', 'zucchini', 'yellow bell pepper', 'eggplant', 'olive oil', 'medium pasta shell', 'small shrimp', 'cherry tomatoes', 'feta cheese', 'red onion', 'dried oregano', 'salt and black pepper']
node.step_1: for the vinaigrette
node.step_2: in a blender process vinegar with mustard , garlic and salt for about 5 seconds
node.step_3: slowly drizzle in the oil until blended
node.step_4: add in honey or sugar if desired , then season with black pepper to taste
node.step_5: refrigerate until ready to use
node.step_6: adjust oven rack to the top position
node.step_7: place the zucchini slices , yellow bell pepper halves and cubed eggplant onto a greased baking sheet
node.step_8: drizzle the oil over veggies and and toss with hands to coat
node.step_9: lightly season both sides with salt and black pepper
node.step_10: broil for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned , turning over once
node.step_11: cool then cut into bite-size pieces
node.step_12: place into a large bowl
node.step_13: boil the pasta shells in a large pot of boiling salted water until just al dente
node.step_14: drain but do not rinse
node.step_15: spread onto the baking sheet that you broiled the veggies on
node.step_16: set aside and cool
node.step_17: place the cooled pasta into the bowl that has the cooked chopped zucchini and bell peppers in , then add in cooked shrimp , cherry tomatoes , feta cheese , red onion and dried oregano
node.step_18: toss well to combine
node.step_19: season with lots black pepper
node.step_20: at this point you may add in the dressing
node.step_21: toss to combine then season with salt and pepper , or you may add in the dressing before serving

node.name: greek pastitsio
node.steps: ['pre-heat the oven to 180c / 350f / gas mark 4', 'cook the macaroni as pack instructions until tender', 'drain', 'meanwhile , fry the minced beef and onions until brown', 'stir in the tomatoes , tomato puree , herbs and seasonings', 'bring to the boil , cover and simmer for 15 minutes', 'to prepare the topping , melt the butter in a pan , add the flour and cook for 1 minute , stirring', 'blend in the milk and bring to the boil , still stirring', 'as soon as it thickens remove from the heat', 'be careful not to burn it', 'stir in 100g of the cheese , the yoghurt and the beaten egg', 'combine the macaroni and minced beef mixture and put into an ovenproof dish', 'pour over the topping and sprinkle with the remaining cheese', 'bake for 35-40 minutes until golden', 'stand for 5-10 minutes before serving to allow the topping to firm up']
node.description: this pastitsio is guaranteed to remind me of holidays to greece, it tastes so devine. leftovers freeze well and should be defrosted before re-heating. i serve it with bread and a green salad. i use skimmed milk for the sauce, but any kind can be used.
node.ingredients: ['macaroni', 'lean ground beef', 'onion', 'chopped tomatoes', 'tomato puree', 'dried oregano', 'ground allspice', 'garlic clove', 'salt', 'butter', 'plain flour', 'milk', 'cheddar cheese', 'natural yoghurt', 'egg']
node.step_1: pre-heat the oven to 180c / 350f / gas mark 4
node.step_2: cook the macaroni as pack instructions until tender
node.step_3: drain
node.step_4: meanwhile , fry the minced beef and onions until brown
node.step_5: stir in the tomatoes , tomato puree , herbs and seasonings
node.step_6: bring to the boil , cover and simmer for 15 minutes
node.step_7: to prepare the topping , melt the butter in a pan , add the flour and cook for 1 minute , stirring
node.step_8: blend in the milk and bring to the boil , still stirring
node.step_9: as soon as it thickens remove from the heat
node.step_10: be careful not to burn it
node.step_11: stir in 100g of the cheese , the yoghurt and the beaten egg
node.step_12: combine the macaroni and minced beef mixture and put into an ovenproof dish
node.step_13: pour over the topping and sprinkle with the remaining cheese
node.step_14: bake for 35-40 minutes until golden
node.step_15: stand for 5-10 minutes before serving to allow the topping to firm up

node.name: greek rice rice with spinach and feta
node.steps: ['over medium heat in a saucepan , combine the rice , broth , and water , and bring to a boil', 'cover , reduce the heat to medium low , and let simmer for 15 to 18 minutes or until the rice has absorbed the liquid', 'transfer to a serving bowl and keep warm', 'in a skillet over medium heat , melt the olive oil and butter together , then add the onion , mushrooms , and garlic for 5 to 7 minutes , then stir in the lemon juice and oregano', 'add the spinach and pepper , then sprinkle with the sherry and toss until the spinach is slightly wilted', 'remove from heat', 'add the crumbled feta and toss until the cheese begins to melt', 'add to the cooked rice , toss well , and serve immediately']
node.description: this recipe for a delicious and easy rice side dish came from michael at gails recipe swap, and ive fiddled with it a little. although i dont get to eat rice often, this one looks so tasty i have to put it here for safe keeping when i get to splurge! :)
node.ingredients: ['long grain rice', 'low sodium chicken broth', 'water', 'olive oil', 'butter', 'onion', 'sliced mushrooms', 'garlic cloves', 'fresh lemon juice', 'dried oregano', 'baby spinach', 'fresh ground black pepper', 'dry sherry', 'feta cheese']
node.step_1: over medium heat in a saucepan , combine the rice , broth , and water , and bring to a boil
node.step_2: cover , reduce the heat to medium low , and let simmer for 15 to 18 minutes or until the rice has absorbed the liquid
node.step_3: transfer to a serving bowl and keep warm
node.step_4: in a skillet over medium heat , melt the olive oil and butter together , then add the onion , mushrooms , and garlic for 5 to 7 minutes , then stir in the lemon juice and oregano
node.step_5: add the spinach and pepper , then sprinkle with the sherry and toss until the spinach is slightly wilted
node.step_6: remove from heat
node.step_7: add the crumbled feta and toss until the cheese begins to melt
node.step_8: add to the cooked rice , toss well , and serve immediately

node.name: greek spinach herb pie without cheese a k a spanakopita
node.steps: ['coarsely chop spinach and place in a colander', 'salt lightly and let drain for 10 minutes', 'press or squeeze to remove all excess liquid', 'in a large mixing bowl , combine spinach , dill , parsley , garlic , onions , leek , pepper , and mix well until ingredients are well blended', 'preheat the oven to 350f', 'spray 9" round or square pyrex plate with cooking spray', 'when laying the sheets in the pan , leave an overlap of phyllo outside the pan rim all the way around', 'lay half the phyllo sheets on the bottom , spraying each one lightly with pam cooking spray', 'spoon in the spinach mixture and spread evenly', 'fold the extending phyllo in over the mixture', 'lay the remaining phyllo sheets on top , spraying each with cooking oil except the top sheet', 'tuck or tim eadges', 'i like to kind of ruffle mine', 'bake at 350f for 45-50 minutes in the middle of the oven', 'when done , remove from the oven and allow to cool 1 / 2 hour before serving']
node.description: spanakopita can be made with or with out cheese. the no cheese version is as popular with greeks as the version with cheese, and is a popular lenten dish. although the name for this dish is often used for the spinach pie with cheese, traditional spanakopita does not include cheese.**cooking time does not include the 30 minutes it needs to sit before serving.**
node.ingredients: ['fresh spinach', 'fresh dill', 'fresh parsley', 'garlic clove', 'spring onions', 'leek', 'pam cooking spray', 'phyllo pastry sheet', 'sea salt', 'fresh ground pepper']
node.step_1: coarsely chop spinach and place in a colander
node.step_2: salt lightly and let drain for 10 minutes
node.step_3: press or squeeze to remove all excess liquid
node.step_4: in a large mixing bowl , combine spinach , dill , parsley , garlic , onions , leek , pepper , and mix well until ingredients are well blended
node.step_5: preheat the oven to 350f
node.step_6: spray 9" round or square pyrex plate with cooking spray
node.step_7: when laying the sheets in the pan , leave an overlap of phyllo outside the pan rim all the way around
node.step_8: lay half the phyllo sheets on the bottom , spraying each one lightly with pam cooking spray
node.step_9: spoon in the spinach mixture and spread evenly
node.step_10: fold the extending phyllo in over the mixture
node.step_11: lay the remaining phyllo sheets on top , spraying each with cooking oil except the top sheet
node.step_12: tuck or tim eadges
node.step_13: i like to kind of ruffle mine
node.step_14: bake at 350f for 45-50 minutes in the middle of the oven
node.step_15: when done , remove from the oven and allow to cool 1 / 2 hour before serving

node.name: green and gold casserole

node.description: this meatless side-dish casserole was affectionately dubbed "trough delight" by my husband. it's rich and tasty and is a huge hit at potlucks. you could even cut them up small and serve as appetizers. from my well-used recipe card i think this came from better homes and gardens, 1987. it's so good! i hope you try it!
node.ingredients: ['refrigerated crescent dinner rolls', 'parmesan cheese', 'zucchini', 'sliced mushrooms', 'onion', 'sour cream', 'flour', 'salt', 'pepper', 'marinated artichoke hearts', 'monterey jack cheese']
node.step_1: lightly grease 9x13 baking dish
node.step_2: unroll 1 package crescent rolls and press evenly in baking dish to cover bottom , sealing perforations
node.step_3: sprinkle with 1 / 4 cup parmesan
node.step_4: bake 350 for 10-15 minutes until golden
node.step_5: meanwhile , place zucchini , onions and mushrooms in a large steamer basket
node.step_6: cover and steam 8-10 minutes
node.step_7: remove and set aside
node.step_8: in large bowl , stir together sour cream , flour and salt and pepper , then add zucchini mixture and artichokes
node.step_9: turn into pan , spread evenly over crust and top with the monterey jack cheese
node.step_10: unroll remaining crescent rolls , separate into triangles , and arrange them on top of cheese
node.step_11: sprinkle with remaining parmesan and bake at 350 for 30-40 minutes until top is golden and filling is heated through

node.name: green apple cider ice
node.steps: ['in a medium pan , boil the cider , uncovered , over medium heat until reduced to 1 cup , about 20-25 minutes', 'add the water , sugar , anise seed , and cinnamon', 'bring to a boil and boil over medium heat for 1 minute , or until sugar dissolves', 'remove from heat , cover , and let cool', 'strain through a double thickness of cheesecloth and set aside', 'place the prepared apples in a food processor bowl , fitted with a steel blade', 'add the lemon juice and zest and puree till very smooth', 'add the 1 / 2 cup of calvados or apple jack , salt , food coloring and the reserved cider mixture and blend', "pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacture's instructions", 'alternately pour into a 10x10 metal baking pan and place in the freezer', 'when ice crystals begin to form 2"all around the edges of the pan , remove and stir till smooth', 'return the pan to freezer and repeat this process two more times , or until a smooth consistency can be reached', 'pack into plastic containers and store in the freezer', 'remove about 10 minutes before to soften the ice slightly', 'scoop into wine glasses or parfaits', 'top with 1 tbls calvados , garnish with an apple slice']
node.description: this is perfect with poultry or any pork dish. if you want a serving for adults, add a dash of calvados or some other co-ordinating liquer for good measure.
node.ingredients: ['apple cider', 'water', 'sugar', 'anise seed', 'ground cinnamon', 'tart apples', 'fresh lemon juice', 'lemon, zest of', 'apple jack', 'salt', 'green food coloring', 'calvados', 'red apple']
node.step_1: in a medium pan , boil the cider , uncovered , over medium heat until reduced to 1 cup , about 20-25 minutes
node.step_2: add the water , sugar , anise seed , and cinnamon
node.step_3: bring to a boil and boil over medium heat for 1 minute , or until sugar dissolves
node.step_4: remove from heat , cover , and let cool
node.step_5: strain through a double thickness of cheesecloth and set aside
node.step_6: place the prepared apples in a food processor bowl , fitted with a steel blade
node.step_7: add the lemon juice and zest and puree till very smooth
node.step_8: add the 1 / 2 cup of calvados or apple jack , salt , food coloring and the reserved cider mixture and blend
node.step_9: pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacture's instructions
node.step_10: alternately pour into a 10x10 metal baking pan and place in the freezer
node.step_11: when ice crystals begin to form 2"all around the edges of the pan , remove and stir till smooth
node.step_12: return the pan to freezer and repeat this process two more times , or until a smooth consistency can be reached
node.step_13: pack into plastic containers and store in the freezer
node.step_14: remove about 10 minutes before to soften the ice slightly
node.step_15: scoop into wine glasses or parfaits
node.step_16: top with 1 tbls calvados , garnish with an apple slice

node.step_1: boil potatoes in water for 4 minutes , drain , rinse and let cool
node.step_2: set aside
node.step_3: over low heat cook onion and bay leaf in one cup of clam broth for 15-20 minutes until cooked through
node.step_4: discard bay leaf and let cool
node.step_5: fry the green chiles in the oil for about 4-5 minutes or until skin blisters but not black
node.step_6: skin chiles , remove seeds and cut into 1 / 2 inch dice
node.step_7: steam the corn in 1 / 4 cup water for 2 minutes until tender
node.step_8: in a large soup pot , combine the oysters with their liquid , the remaining broth and the green chiles and cook over low heat for 2-5 minutes , then add the potatoes , onion and red pepper and bring to a boil over medium high heat
node.step_9: stir in half-and-half , keeping mixture below a boil
node.step_10: stir in salt , corn and butter
node.step_11: pour soup into soup bowls and garnish with marjoram

node.steps: ['cook chicken -- you can even grill for more enhanced flavor', 'in large dutch oven , place 3 cans of soup and 4 cups of milk', 'mix til well combined', 'bring to medium simmer and add bouillon cube', 'simmer on low for 10 minutes', 'add cooked and chopped / mashed potatoes , combine', 'add chicken , chopped chile , garlic pepper , and salt', 'combine well and let simmer about 20 minutes', 'preferred method for us is put all in crock pot and put on low for 4-6 hours']
node.description: this is my best friend's and my attempt to replicate the green chicken chile soup served at los arcos steakhouse in truth or consequence, new mexico. we love it and have it every time we are at the lake. i called several years ago and they will not give out the recipe. my best friend and i decided we needed to try to replicate it and used our husbands as guinea pigs -- we are close! this is fabulous any time but especially good on a cold new mexico night!
node.ingredients: ['chicken breasts', 'chile', 'cream of mushroom soup', 'cream of potato soup', 'chicken bouillon', 'milk', 'potatoes', 'pepper', 'salt']
node.step_1: cook chicken -- you can even grill for more enhanced flavor
node.step_2: in large dutch oven , place 3 cans of soup and 4 cups of milk
node.step_3: mix til well combined
node.step_4: bring to medium simmer and add bouillon cube
node.step_5: simmer on low for 10 minutes
node.step_6: add cooked and chopped / mashed potatoes , combine
node.step_7: add chicken , chopped chile , garlic pepper , and salt
node.step_8: combine well and let simmer about 20 minutes
node.step_9: preferred method for us is put all in crock pot and put on low for 4-6 hours

node.description: wonderful green chile chowder. i found this in an old junior league cookbook from el paso, called "seasoned with sun". their comment about the recipe: "we know people who will buy this book for this recipe alone." cooking and prep time does not include roasting the green chiles.
node.ingredients: ['jalapeno', 'green chili', 'onion', 'potatoes', 'seasoning salt', 'chicken stock', 'margarine', 'flour', 'milk', 'cheddar cheese']
node.step_1: combine the jalapeno , green chiles , onions , potatoes , seasoning salt , and chicken stock
node.step_2: bring to a boil
node.step_3: reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes
node.step_4: melt margarine over low heat
node.step_5: add flour to blend
node.step_6: cook , stirring constantly for 3 minutes to make a blonde roux
node.step_7: strain the liquid from the potato , chile and onion mixture , reserving 3 cups cooking liquid
node.step_8: mash 1 / 2 of the potato , chile and onion mixture , cover to keep it warm
node.step_9: reserve the other half , keeping it warm
node.step_10: stir the reserved 3 cups of cooking liquid into the roux
node.step_11: raise heat , stirring with a wire whisk until thickened
node.step_12: add milk to thickened liquid and continue to stir until it comes to a simmer
node.step_13: turn off heat
node.step_14: add mashed potato , chile and onion mixture
node.step_15: stir in and blend well
node.step_16: add reserved cubed potatoes , chile and onions
node.step_17: serve with shredded cheddar cheese on top
node.step_18: to roast chilies:
node.step_19: poke a hole in the end of each shile with an ice pick
node.step_20: spread chiles on a cookie sheet and broil , turning until skins are blistered on all sides
node.step_21: if chiles begin to get too brown , lower the rack to keep them from burning
node.step_22: when chiles are completely roasted , place them between dish towels or in a plastic bag to steam
node.step_23: this aids in removing the skins
node.step_24: peel off the skins as soon as the chiles are cool enough to handle by laying chiles on a board and slitting one side lengthwise
node.step_25: open chiles carefully and removed seeds and lateral veins
node.step_26: rinse under cool water and place on a towel to dry

node.description: don't use butter instead of lard; the texture is too soft and it won't cream properly. if you must substitute, use vegetable shortening.
node.ingredients: ['corn husks', 'chicken meat', 'canned diced green chiles', 'queso fresco', 'jalapeno peppers', 'fresh cilantro', 'garlic cloves', 'scallions', 'ground cumin', 'mexican oregano', 'ground coriander', 'kosher salt', 'black pepper', 'fresh lime juice', 'masa harina', 'baking powder', 'salt', 'lard', 'low sodium chicken broth']
node.step_1: fill a large bowl or pot with warm water
node.step_2: put the corn husks in the water and weight them down so they stay immersed
node.step_3: combine all filling ingredients
node.step_4: set aside
node.step_5: combine masa , baking powder , and salt
node.step_6: in a standing mixer , beat the lard until it becomes light and fluffy
node.step_7: gradually mix in dry ingredients
node.step_8: slowly add chicken broth just until a soft dough forms
node.step_9: to assemble the tamales , put a spoonful of dough on the smooth side of a corn husk , smooth it down to a thin layer , and put a smaller spoonful of filling on the dough
node.step_10: bring the two sides of the husk together so that the dough rolls around the filling and the husk overlaps itself
node.step_11: fold up the bottom and tie it with a bit of string or a strand of corn husk
node.step_12: set the tamales open end up in a steamer or colander
node.step_13: put the steamer in a large pot with some water in the bottom
node.step_14: the water musn't touch the tamales
node.step_15: cover tightly and steam over medium heat for 90-120 minutes
node.step_16: once cooked , tamales can be kept in the freezer
node.step_17: to reheat , put in a microwave-safe bowl , cover , and cook on high for about one minute per tamale

node.name: green coriander rice
node.steps: ['place the capsicum , onion , garlic , coriander and parsley in a food processor', 'blend to a fine paste', 'if you dont have a processor- chop ingredients as finely as possible or use a mortar and pestle', 'set aside', 'in a saucepan , heat the butter and oil', 'add the rice and fry gently for 2 to 3 minutes- until the grains become translucent', 'quickly stir the herb paste into the rice', 'continue to cook over heat for another 2 minutes , stirring constantly', 'pour in the boiling stock and season with pepper', 'bring to the boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer', 'cover and cook 10- 15 minutes , or until the rice is tender and the stock has been absorbed', 'watch closely after the 10 minute mark and add some extra water if more liquid is required', 'remove from the heat and leave to stand , with the lid covered for a few minutes', 'fluff the rice with a fork to seperate the grains and serve garnished with chopped coriander leaves or sprigs']
node.description: a tasty side for simple grilled chicken or meat. being gluten-free i tend to eat a lot of rice and this makes for a great change. i love the peppery flavour of coriander. use a gluten-free stock to make this recipe suitable to a gluten-free diet (i like to use massell brand )
node.ingredients: ['green capsicum', 'onion', 'garlic clove', 'fresh coriander', 'flat leaf parsley', 'butter', 'virgin olive oil', 'long-grain white rice', 'chicken stock', 'fresh ground pepper', 'coriander leaves']
node.step_1: place the capsicum , onion , garlic , coriander and parsley in a food processor
node.step_2: blend to a fine paste
node.step_3: if you dont have a processor- chop ingredients as finely as possible or use a mortar and pestle
node.step_4: set aside
node.step_5: in a saucepan , heat the butter and oil
node.step_6: add the rice and fry gently for 2 to 3 minutes- until the grains become translucent
node.step_7: quickly stir the herb paste into the rice
node.step_8: continue to cook over heat for another 2 minutes , stirring constantly
node.step_9: pour in the boiling stock and season with pepper
node.step_10: bring to the boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer
node.step_11: cover and cook 10- 15 minutes , or until the rice is tender and the stock has been absorbed
node.step_12: watch closely after the 10 minute mark and add some extra water if more liquid is required
node.step_13: remove from the heat and leave to stand , with the lid covered for a few minutes
node.step_14: fluff the rice with a fork to seperate the grains and serve garnished with chopped coriander leaves or sprigs

node.name: green goddess spinach dip

node.description:
are you all as devastated as me about the death of *gourmet* magazine? i could weep. luckily, i have a near-complete collection of issues going back to 'way before i was born, so i can live on those the rest of my life!
this recipe (of course i've fiddled a little with it) was on the last page of the last issue, and even my husband, not usually a big fan of creamy dips, keeps getting it out of the fridge and eating it cold with pita crisps. best served warm, though...

node.name: green mango chutney
node.steps: ['toss the mango thoroughly with the ground sea salt in a large stainless steel bowl or saucepan and leave to stand , covered , overnight', 'place the well-drained mangoes into a large stainless steel saucepan or stockpot and add all of the other ingredients', 'bring the saucepan to the boil over medium heat , stirring occasionally', 'when the mixture is boiling , reduce the heat and simmer for 2 hours', 'bottle immediately in clean , warm , sterilised jars and seal tightly', "this chutney is best left for a month or two to mature , but tastes great if you can't wait that long"]
node.description:
yet again another recipe from my favourite paper, and writer/chef jeremy vincent. i have posted the recipe as written. this is a fantastic and great recipe for the use over the summer months. i got 4 jars from this recipe although they were smaller jars. jeremy's comments from the weekly times paper were -- the term chutney comes from the east indian chatni, meaning strongly spiced, and is described as a condiment, which usually consists of a mix of chopped fruits, vinegar, spices and sugar cooked into a chunky spread.
most chutneys are on the spicy-hot side, but it's easy to adjust the heat factor if you make your own.
i love the idea of making a small amount of several chutneys, so that i'm not stuck with a huge number of jars of one recipe, but lots of different flavours to pick from.
i came across some green mangoes in my asian grocer, and so the obvious solution was to use it to make some chutney.
node.ingredients: ['green mangoes', 'sea salt', 'white wine vinegar', 'brown sugar', 'sultanas', 'fresh ginger', 'allspice', 'nutmeg', 'ground cloves', 'chili powder', 'garlic clove', 'onion']
node.step_1: toss the mango thoroughly with the ground sea salt in a large stainless steel bowl or saucepan and leave to stand , covered , overnight
node.step_2: place the well-drained mangoes into a large stainless steel saucepan or stockpot and add all of the other ingredients
node.step_3: bring the saucepan to the boil over medium heat , stirring occasionally
node.step_4: when the mixture is boiling , reduce the heat and simmer for 2 hours
node.step_5: bottle immediately in clean , warm , sterilised jars and seal tightly
node.step_6: this chutney is best left for a month or two to mature , but tastes great if you can't wait that long

node.ingredients: ['green olives', 'olive oil', 'yellow onion', 'garlic cloves', 'chicken stock', 'whipping cream', 'flour', 'black pepper', 'tabasco sauce', 'dry sherry']
node.step_1: first make a roux with the 3 tablespoons of flour and 4 tablespoons of olive oil added to a saute pan and cooked until it darkens
node.step_2: make this roux first so that it will be cool when you are ready to add it to the soup
node.step_3: soak the olives in cold water for 1 hour
node.step_4: drain and coarsely chop the olives
node.step_5: heat a saute pan and add 3 tablespoons of oil , onion , and garlic , along with 2 / 3 of the olives
node.step_6: saute until the onions are transparent
node.step_7: puree the mixture in a food processor along with 1 cup of the stock
node.step_8: this much of the recipe can be made up to two days ahead if needed
node.step_9: place this mixture into a 4 quart saucepan and the rest of the stock
node.step_10: simmer for 20 minutes and add cream
node.step_11: whisk in the roux a little at a time and simmer , stirring constantly until thickened
node.step_12: add pepper to taste and remaining chopped olives , tabasco , and sherry

node.description: this is my version of a traditional thai raw salad with a mildly spicy seasoning. i acquired the original recipe from the blue elephant cooking school. the dried shrimp does tend to give this dish a strong flavour. like my fellow garlic lovers here at zaar, the first time i made this i used more than one clove of garlic, 3 to be exact, but in this dish to much garlic becomes overpowering and one misses out on the wonderful combination of flavours.

node.step_1: in a mortar , roughly pound the garlic and chillies
node.step_2: add the beans and pound , then the shrimps and pound again until crushed
node.step_3: add the sugar , fish sauce and lime juice and stir together
node.step_4: add the tomatoes and press with the pestle to bruise the tomatoes
node.step_5: add the peanuts and the papaya and stir until well mixed in
node.step_6: serve cold in a round dish lined with lettuce leaves and sprinkle coriander leaves on to of the salad

node.description: recipes for green tomatoes are a necessity for anyone who persists in growing tomatoes in a climate that is guaranteed to have a frost just as the first few ripen. i thought this was a pretty strange idea at first, but i did have all those #$%& green tomatoes. regular mincemeat i find too sweet and rich. regular mincemeat needs something mild and slightly astringent to tone it down.... something like.... green tomatoes!

node.step_4: drain

node.step_6: simmer until thick , stirring frequently
node.step_7: add the spices , salt , rum , cornstarch and lemon juice
node.step_8: simmer , stirring constantly , for about 5 minutes
node.step_9: pack into sterilized 500ml jars and seal
node.step_10: place in a boiling water bath for 20 minutes

node.description: the chicken is lightly coated in the prepared tangy sauce grilled and then placed back in the skillet to coat and cook in the sauce, this recipe also works well with pork chops although you will need to adjust cooking time, this is not a sweet sauce, if you prefer sweeter then increase the brown sugar to taste, i also add in 1 teaspoon liquid smoke to the sauce but that is optional, the sauce made up to a day in advance if desired, cooking time is for chicken only, i most always double this recipe, i have also listed the double amounts after the ingredients, if you are doubling keep the onion at one and use no more than 2 tablespoons fresh garlic.
node.ingredients: ['oil', 'onion', 'garlic', 'ketchup', 'honey', 'brown sugar', 'apple cider vinegar', 'worcestershire sauce', 'prepared yellow mustard', 'seasoning salt', 'paprika', 'black pepper', 'cayenne', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts', 'salt and black pepper']
node.step_1: heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat
node.step_2: add in onion and saute for about 3 minutes
node.step_3: add in garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes
node.step_4: stir in ketchup , honey , brown sugar , cider vinegar , worcestershire sauce , mustard , seasoned salt , paprika and black pepper
node.step_5: bring to a simmer over medium heat , then reduce to low and simmer uncovered for about 20 minutes
node.step_6: season with salt to taste , and cayenne
node.step_7: remove from heat and allow to cool
node.step_8: dip the chicken into the sauce and turn to coat
node.step_9: season the chicken with salt and black pepper if desired then place on the grill for about 10-15 minutes , turning once during cooking
node.step_10: transfer the chicken to the skillet and simmer in sauce over medium heat for 5-6 minutes on each side

node.description: although throwing an ear of corn on the grill is perfectly fine why not try something different?? these are quick, easy and very flavorful. feel free to switch up the seasonings to compliment whatever main dish you are serving! the way they are prepared they would go great with beef, pork, fish or poultry. your tastes may vary slightly.......so do what you like!! enjoy!!
node.ingredients: ['baby bok choy', 'tomatoes', 'olive oil', 'salt', 'pepper', 'italian seasoning', 'garlic cloves']
node.step_1: halve bok choy and tomatoes
node.step_2: sprinkle cut sides with salt pepper and italian seasoning , to taste
node.step_3: in small saute pan cook garlic over medium heat , do not let it get brown , you are only trying to infuse the olive oil with the garlic flavor
node.step_4: when finished pour oil into small pyrex measuring cup , add salt , pepper and a small amount of italian seasoning , stir
node.step_5: reserve
node.step_6: grill bok choy and tomatoes cut side up over medium direct heat until they have slight grill marks , turn and do the same on the cut side
node.step_7: don't be afraid a little char adds alot of flavor
node.step_8: bok choy should be grilled with the bulbs over the direct heat and the leaves over indirect heat to prevent burning
node.step_9: remove from grill and drizzle cut side with reserved olive oil and garlic mixture
node.step_10: serve 1 / 2 bok choy and 1 / 2 tomato to each guest , or yourself -- enjoy !

node.name: grilled bourbon marinated pork chops or pork tenderloins
node.steps: ['in a bowl whisk together the marinade ingredients', 'place in a large zip-loc plastic bag', 'add in the pork chops or 2 pork tenderloins', 'seal the bag', 'turn to coat with the marinade', 'refrigerate for a minimum of 12 hours', 'set grill to high heat', 'remove the pork and discard the marinade', 'place on grill', 'for pork chops cook for about 15 minutes on each side , depending on how thick your chops are', 'for pork tenderloins , cook for about 25 minutes turning occasionally or until the pork is cooked', 'tent with foil and let sit for about 10 minutes before slicing', 'delicious !']
node.description: plan ahead the pork needs to marinade for a minimum of 12 hours. use this marinade for 2 pork tenderloins or 6-8 pork chops. you can reduce the bourbon to 1/3 cup but 1/2 cup is better!
node.ingredients: ['pork chops', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'bourbon', 'worcestershire sauce', 'water', 'vegetable oil', 'garlic', 'brown sugar', 'black pepper', 'gingerroot']
node.step_1: in a bowl whisk together the marinade ingredients
node.step_2: place in a large zip-loc plastic bag
node.step_3: add in the pork chops or 2 pork tenderloins
node.step_4: seal the bag
node.step_5: turn to coat with the marinade
node.step_6: refrigerate for a minimum of 12 hours
node.step_7: set grill to high heat
node.step_8: remove the pork and discard the marinade
node.step_9: place on grill
node.step_10: for pork chops cook for about 15 minutes on each side , depending on how thick your chops are
node.step_11: for pork tenderloins , cook for about 25 minutes turning occasionally or until the pork is cooked

node.step_13: delicious !

node.name: grilled cabbage wedges with a creamy onion vinaigrette
node.steps: ['vinaigrette -- make ahead', 'add the onion , sugar , vinegar , mustard to a blender and puree until smooth', 'slowly add in the olive oil and continue to blend until you get a creamy dressing', 'season with salt and pepper to taste', 'i like to make this ahead and store in a small jar or tupperware container', 'then just shake before serving', 'bacon -- i also make this ahead to save some time', 'simply add the chopped bacon to a small saute pan on medium heat and slowly start to cook the bacon', 'there should be enough fat in the bacon , so no oil or butter is necessary', 'saute until the bacon is crisp', 'remove to a plate lined with a paper towel to drain', 'set to the side until you are ready to make the cabbage', 'i like to make mine a day ahead and store in a small ziplock back in the refrigerator', 'cabbage -- first , remove any soft or old outside leaves from the head and then cut in wedges', 'i usually will get 6-8 wedges per head', 'melt the butter , i did mine in a small glass in the microwave', 'brush the cut sides of the cabbage with the melted butter and season well with salt and pepper', 'grill -- this can be done on a charcoal , gas or even an inside grill', 'grill each side approximately 5 minutes', 'you want a bit of a char , but not too long', 'you want the cabbage to still be a bit crispy', 'serve -- top each cabbage wedge with the onion vinaigrette and bacon bits', 'this is absolutely delish ! enjoy !']
node.description: i love cabbage and this is a nice twist for a salad. a sweet onion vinaigrette, bits of sauteed bacon, and warm cabbage that is grilled but but still is a bit crispy. this can either be served as salad or as a vegetable side dish.
node.ingredients: ['green cabbage', 'bacon', 'butter', 'salt', 'pepper', 'sweet onion', 'olive oil', 'red wine vinegar', 'sugar', 'ground mustard']
node.step_1: vinaigrette -- make ahead
node.step_2: add the onion , sugar , vinegar , mustard to a blender and puree until smooth
node.step_3: slowly add in the olive oil and continue to blend until you get a creamy dressing
node.step_4: season with salt and pepper to taste
node.step_5: i like to make this ahead and store in a small jar or tupperware container
node.step_6: then just shake before serving
node.step_7: bacon -- i also make this ahead to save some time
node.step_8: simply add the chopped bacon to a small saute pan on medium heat and slowly start to cook the bacon
node.step_9: there should be enough fat in the bacon , so no oil or butter is necessary
node.step_10: saute until the bacon is crisp
node.step_11: remove to a plate lined with a paper towel to drain
node.step_12: set to the side until you are ready to make the cabbage
node.step_13: i like to make mine a day ahead and store in a small ziplock back in the refrigerator
node.step_14: cabbage -- first , remove any soft or old outside leaves from the head and then cut in wedges
node.step_15: i usually will get 6-8 wedges per head
node.step_16: melt the butter , i did mine in a small glass in the microwave
node.step_17: brush the cut sides of the cabbage with the melted butter and season well with salt and pepper
node.step_18: grill -- this can be done on a charcoal , gas or even an inside grill
node.step_19: grill each side approximately 5 minutes
node.step_20: you want a bit of a char , but not too long
node.step_21: you want the cabbage to still be a bit crispy
node.step_22: serve -- top each cabbage wedge with the onion vinaigrette and bacon bits

node.name: grilled cheddar and apple butter sandwich
node.steps: ['the sandwich is assembled in a cold , non stick skillet', 'butter one side of first slice of bread and place butter-side-down in skillet', 'place one slice of cheese on bread , then 1 tablespoon apple butter in the center of the cheese', 'top apple butter with second slice of cheese', 'butter one side of second piece of bread and place butter-side-up on last slice of cheese', 'turn on heat to medium / low heat', 'toast each sides l o w l y and carefully to achieve a gooey inside and toasty-golden outside', 'eat and repeat !']
node.description: this is an adopted recipe that i found to be a nice twist on the traditional grilled cheese. the original chef's comments are as follows: "for some reason, i put a jar of apple butter in my grocery cart today (childhood nostalgia?)...i can't imagine i'm the only one in the world to come up with this, but i dreamt it up today, and i didn't see it on zaar...so here it is! my 13-month-old daughter ate it right up and literally screamed for more! i used mild tillamook cheddar cheese, but i think a sharp white cheddar would be amazing, too. take care to toast it *s l o w l y* neglected (burnt) grilled sandwiches that are "scraped off" and presented scraped-side-down on the plate, are a dirty trick imho."
node.ingredients: ['challah', 'mild cheddar cheese', 'apple butter', 'butter']
node.step_1: the sandwich is assembled in a cold , non stick skillet
node.step_2: butter one side of first slice of bread and place butter-side-down in skillet
node.step_3: place one slice of cheese on bread , then 1 tablespoon apple butter in the center of the cheese
node.step_4: top apple butter with second slice of cheese
node.step_5: butter one side of second piece of bread and place butter-side-up on last slice of cheese
node.step_6: turn on heat to medium / low heat
node.step_7: toast each sides l o w l y and carefully to achieve a gooey inside and toasty-golden outside
node.step_8: eat and repeat !

node.description: i took this excellent recipe from the september 2008 issue of cooking light magazine. this is a creamy, hearty one-dish meal. i usually follow it with a fruit salad for dessert.
node.ingredients: ['boneless skinless chicken', 'salt', 'fresh ground pepper', 'cooking spray', 'farfalle pasta', 'butter', 'garlic cloves', 'milk', 'flour', 'pesto sauce', 'parmesan cheese', 'grape tomatoes', 'fresh basil']
node.step_1: set the grill to medium high heat
node.step_2: spray with cooking spray
node.step_3: season the chicken with the salt and pepper
node.step_4: place on the grill and cook for approximately 10 minutes - until the juices run clear
node.step_5: remove from grill and let stand for five minutes
node.step_6: cut chicken into bite-sized pieces
node.step_7: keep warm
node.step_8: cook pasta according to package directions
node.step_9: drain in a colander placed over a bowl
node.step_10: save 1 / 2 cup of the cooking liquid
node.step_11: place the drained pasta into a large serving bowl
node.step_12: heat butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat
node.step_13: add the garlic and cook one minute , stirring occasionally
node.step_14: combine the 1 / 2 cup milk and flour in a small bowl
node.step_15: whisk until smooth
node.step_16: add this mixture to the garlic and butter whisking constantly
node.step_17: stir in the pesto
node.step_18: slowly add the remaining milk - whisking constantly
node.step_19: cook , stirring frequently , for 8 minutes or until the sauce thickens
node.step_20: add the reserved cooking liquid and one cup of the shredded cheese , stir until the cheese melts
node.step_21: add salt and pepper if desired
node.step_22: add the chicken and the sauce to the bowl of pasta , tossing well to coat
node.step_23: add the tomatoes and basil and gently toss again
node.step_24: sprinkle with the remaining cheese and serve immediately

node.name: grilled chicken and pineapple topped with brie
node.steps: ['place last six ingredients into a gallon sized ziploc bag , along with the 4 chicken breasts', 'toss chicken to coat thoroughly', 'allow chicken breasts to marinade for at least 4 hours', 'after marinading , preheat grill to a medium high heat', 'place chicken breasts on grill', 'grill chicken for ~8 minutes on each side', 'in the last 2 minutes of grilling , place the four pineapple rings on the grill and grill for 1 minute on each side', 'after the chicken and pineapple are complete , remove from grill and place on a broiler safe plate', 'place one ring onto each chicken breast and top that with 3 oz of brie', 'put the plate under the broiler for about 2 minutes or until brie just starts to brown', 'take the entree out from under the broiler and serve immediately , topped with the extra cilantro if you want !', 'enjoy !']
node.description: there is a local bar here that serves a sandwich that is grilled chicken, topped with pineapple, brie and a cilantro-lime mayo that i crave on a daily basis. i decided to come up with an entree to satisfy my cravings, and it was absolutely delicious. it was very easy/quick and my hubby gobbled it up and was eating a second helping within minutes! prep time does not include marinade time.
node.ingredients: ['boneless skinless chicken breasts', 'pineapple rings', 'brie cheese', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'fresh cilantro', 'garlic clove', 'lime juice', 'salt', 'pepper']
node.step_1: place last six ingredients into a gallon sized ziploc bag , along with the 4 chicken breasts
node.step_2: toss chicken to coat thoroughly
node.step_3: allow chicken breasts to marinade for at least 4 hours
node.step_4: after marinading , preheat grill to a medium high heat
node.step_5: place chicken breasts on grill
node.step_6: grill chicken for ~8 minutes on each side
node.step_7: in the last 2 minutes of grilling , place the four pineapple rings on the grill and grill for 1 minute on each side
node.step_8: after the chicken and pineapple are complete , remove from grill and place on a broiler safe plate
node.step_9: place one ring onto each chicken breast and top that with 3 oz of brie
node.step_10: put the plate under the broiler for about 2 minutes or until brie just starts to brown
node.step_11: take the entree out from under the broiler and serve immediately , topped with the extra cilantro if you want !
node.step_12: enjoy !

node.description: this is definitely one of my husband's favorite meals. like most men, he doesn't ever offer a suggestion of what to have for dinner but he has for these. i'm sure they would be great grilled. i have only made them by first baking them in the oven and then cooking them an additional 2 hours on low with the sauce in my crockpot. i find they come out wonderfully tender. the instructions are for grilling--do whatever you please.

node.description: this middle eastern inspired sundae is a cool way to end a meal with thick yogurt standing in for ice cream on a hot summer night. try topping your yogurt with grilled fresh figs. just brush them with a mixture of honey and fragrant orange blossom water and grill until caramelized. arrange over scoops of cold yogurt and sprinkle with toasted pistachios and a drizzle of additional honey mix for a new take on a classic treat.

node.step_5: reserve the remaining mixture for drizzling over the sundaes
node.step_6: place the figs on the grill cut-side down
node.step_7: cover the grill and cook until grill marks appear on the bottom , about 2 minutes
node.step_8: using a flat metal spatula , flip the figs , cover the grill , and cook until grill marks appear on the second side and the figs begin to soften , about 1 to 2 minutes more
node.step_9: remove the figs to the reserved baking sheet

node.step_12: serve immediately

node.description: from everyday with rachel ray, it's a bit unusual, but it's great, kind of like a knife and fork version of a steak sandwich this uses a skirt steak, but any steak would be good here - i used filet mignons seasoned with my favorite bbq seasoning, and i used sourdough bread. i cut the recipe in half for two filets, had three smallish vine-ripe tomatoes, and three slices of sourdough bread, it worked out well. serve with a green salad for a great summer dinner.
node.ingredients: ['garlic cloves', 'olive oil', 'garlic salt', 'black pepper', 'cayenne pepper', 'tomatoes', 'skirt steaks', 'kaiser rolls', 'fresh rosemary']
node.step_1: preheat grill to medium high
node.step_2: in a bowl , combine garlic , olive oil , salt , black pepper , and cayenne pepper
node.step_3: brush the tomatoes with the seasoned oil , and grill until lightly charred , turning once - about 12 minutes , and set them aside
node.step_4: brush the steak and the rolls with the seasoned oil , and grill the rolls for a couple of minutes , turning occasionally
node.step_5: grill the steak , turning once , to desired temperature
node.step_6: let the meat rest , then slice it thinly , and divide among 4 plates
node.step_7: coarsely chop the rolls and tomatoes , and toss in a bowl with the rosemary , any residual meat juices , and additional salt and pepper if desired
node.step_8: top each plate of steak with the bread salad

node.step_1: prepare a medium-hot fire in grill
node.step_2: in a small saucepan , warm preserves , lemon juice , ginger , mustard , salt and pepper over medium heat , stirring , just until preserves melt , about 2 minutes
node.step_3: grill chicken , skin side down , 10 minutes
node.step_4: turn and grill 5 minutes

node.name: grilled glazed salmon
node.steps: ['in a small bowl , combine brown sugar , melted butter , lemon juice , dill , and cayenne pepper , mixing well', 'pour 1 / 2 cup of this sauce into a small saucepan- once the fish is in its final 5 minutes of cooking time , heat this until warm and pour over cooked fish', 'set aside the remaining unheated sauce to use for basting the fish as you grill', 'place the salmon , skin side down , on a large platter and season with lemon pepper seasoning and sea salt to taste', 'lightly brush grill grates with some oil and heat grill to medium', 'carefully slide salmon off of the platter and onto the grill , skin side down , using a large metal spatula to help', 'cover grill and cook fish , undisturbed , for 5 minutes exactly', 'baste liberally with the reserved basting sauce , re-cover , and cook another 10-15 minutes- basting every 5 minutes', 'use up all of the basting sauce', 'fish is ready when it begins to flake and is starting to appear as if milk is seeping out', 'carefullly remove to a fresh , clean platter and pour the 1 / 2 cup sauce you had simmering on the stove over the top of the fish']
node.description: this is by far, my favorite company meal. we eat this salmon very often. it is so tender and delicious. everyone i have served it to has always loved it - even children. don't be afraid of the cayenne pepper - this is not a spicy dish. the original version of this recipe actually called for more cayenne (3/4 tsp.) which you are welcome to try if you like it a bit more spicy. the salmon called for in this recipe is a whole side of a fish - do not cut up until after it is cooked. the skin acts as a moisture protector on the grill and also helps hold the fish together- it can be removed after cooking, if you prefer. adapted from a similar recipe in quick cooking magazine.
node.ingredients: ['brown sugar', 'butter', 'lemon juice', 'dried dill weed', 'cayenne pepper', 'salmon fillets', 'lemon-pepper seasoning', 'sea salt']
node.step_1: in a small bowl , combine brown sugar , melted butter , lemon juice , dill , and cayenne pepper , mixing well
node.step_2: pour 1 / 2 cup of this sauce into a small saucepan- once the fish is in its final 5 minutes of cooking time , heat this until warm and pour over cooked fish
node.step_3: set aside the remaining unheated sauce to use for basting the fish as you grill
node.step_4: place the salmon , skin side down , on a large platter and season with lemon pepper seasoning and sea salt to taste
node.step_5: lightly brush grill grates with some oil and heat grill to medium
node.step_6: carefully slide salmon off of the platter and onto the grill , skin side down , using a large metal spatula to help
node.step_7: cover grill and cook fish , undisturbed , for 5 minutes exactly
node.step_8: baste liberally with the reserved basting sauce , re-cover , and cook another 10-15 minutes- basting every 5 minutes
node.step_9: use up all of the basting sauce
node.step_10: fish is ready when it begins to flake and is starting to appear as if milk is seeping out
node.step_11: carefullly remove to a fresh , clean platter and pour the 1 / 2 cup sauce you had simmering on the stove over the top of the fish

node.name: grilled halibut with pineapple chipotle salsa
node.steps: ['plump raisins in rum for 30 minutes', 'drain', 'heat grill to medium high heat', 'brush pineapple slices with oil & grill until lightly caramelized on both sides', 'cool & cut into 1 / 2" pieces', 'put in mixing bowl', 'combine chipotles , lime juice , orange zest & juice', 'whisk in olive oil', 'pour over pineapple chunks , fold in green onion , red pepper , cilantro & raisins', 'salt to taste', 'set aside', 'brush halibut heavily with oil & grill just until fish is opaque throughout , gently turning once', 'the grilling time on halibut is pretty short so keep a close eye on it to avoid over cooking', 'a 1-inch halibut steak will grill up in about 10 minutes over a medium high heat', 'thinner cuts and fillets can cook in as little time as 6 minutes', 'serve topped with salsa']
node.description: halibut is a low fat, very mild flavored fish with a firm flaky meat. it is easily available year round, relatively inexpensive, easy to grill and lends itself to almost any flavor. i found this recipe in the local living magazine & was intrigued by the salsa. i'm sure it would be wonderful with any mild fish such as grouper, flounder or snapper.
node.ingredients: ['raisins', 'dark rum', 'fresh pineapple', 'vegetable oil', 'chipotle chiles in adobo', 'lime, juice of', 'orange, juice of', 'orange, zest of', 'olive oil', 'green onion', 'roasted red peppers', 'cilantro', 'salt', 'halibut steaks']
node.step_1: plump raisins in rum for 30 minutes
node.step_2: drain
node.step_3: heat grill to medium high heat
node.step_4: brush pineapple slices with oil & grill until lightly caramelized on both sides
node.step_5: cool & cut into 1 / 2" pieces
node.step_6: put in mixing bowl
node.step_7: combine chipotles , lime juice , orange zest & juice
node.step_8: whisk in olive oil
node.step_9: pour over pineapple chunks , fold in green onion , red pepper , cilantro & raisins
node.step_10: salt to taste
node.step_11: set aside
node.step_12: brush halibut heavily with oil & grill just until fish is opaque throughout , gently turning once
node.step_13: the grilling time on halibut is pretty short so keep a close eye on it to avoid over cooking
node.step_14: a 1-inch halibut steak will grill up in about 10 minutes over a medium high heat
node.step_15: thinner cuts and fillets can cook in as little time as 6 minutes
node.step_16: serve topped with salsa

node.description: this recipe cooks up very quickly making it great for weeknight meals. the ham steak is lightly glazed with a honey lime sauce and accompanied by wedges of basted and grilled cantaloupe and pineapple. serve with rice and a simple salad for an easy, quick to prepare meal.
node.ingredients: ['butter', 'honey', 'lime juice', 'nutmeg', 'ham', 'cantaloupe', 'pineapple']
node.step_1: combine the butter , honey , lime juice and nutmeg in a small saucepan
node.step_2: heat and stir until well blended
node.step_3: slash the outer layer of fat on the ham at 2" intervals
node.step_4: peel the cantaloupe , de-seed it and cut into 6 wedges
node.step_5: peel the pineapple and cut it into 6 slices 3 / 4" thick
node.step_6: do not core the pineapple as it will make it easier to handle on the grill
node.step_7: brush both sides of the ham with the basting sauce and put on a medium hot grill
node.step_8: cook for 16-20 minutes , turning and basting frequently
node.step_9: about 8 minutes before the ham is done , baste the fruit with the sauce and place it on the grill
node.step_10: basting often , cook the fruit until it's well glazed and lightly brown on all sides
node.step_11: to serve , place the ham and fruit on a platter and cut thin slices across the grain of the ham

node.name: grilled italian meatballs
node.steps: ['combine all ingredients except pasta sauce in a large mixing bowl and mix thoroughly', 'if using charcoal- build your fire and make it low-medium heat , about 225-250f coat the grates with oil or non-stick spray', 'shape mixture into balls slightly smaller than a baseball , but bigger than a golf ball and then set them aside', 'update: i started using a 1 / 4 cup measuring cup to scoop the mixture and it makes the meatballs just the right size', 'pour half of the sauce in a grill safe stock pot or roasting pan that will be large enough to hold all the meatballs', 'place the pot / pan on the grill away from the direct heat when the fire is ready', 'when the grill is ready place the meatballs directly over the heat and sear on both the top and bottom for 3-5 minutes per side', 'when you are done searing the meatballs , place them away from the direct heat', 'let them cook for 5-8 more minutes or until the meatballs are firm , but not fully cooked and then place all the meatballs in the pot / pan and place that directly over the heat source', 'cook for an additional 8-10 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 155-160 degrees f']
node.description: i started making these in the spring of 2006 when we moved to a new house and i found a meat market with the best italian sausage i have ever had. the sausage i use already has red and green bell peppers and diced onions in it. it is the only stuff i buy now. i cook on a charcoal grill, and it really adds to the overall flavor in a way gas just could not. prep time does not include the time it takes for charcoal to ash over. the lid should be closed the whole time unless turning or moving the meatballs.
node.ingredients: ['sausage', 'hamburger', 'italian seasoned breadcrumbs', 'dried basil', 'eggs', 'romano cheese', 'red bell pepper', 'green bell pepper', 'onion', 'marinara sauce']
node.step_1: combine all ingredients except pasta sauce in a large mixing bowl and mix thoroughly
node.step_2: if using charcoal- build your fire and make it low-medium heat , about 225-250f coat the grates with oil or non-stick spray
node.step_3: shape mixture into balls slightly smaller than a baseball , but bigger than a golf ball and then set them aside
node.step_4: update: i started using a 1 / 4 cup measuring cup to scoop the mixture and it makes the meatballs just the right size
node.step_5: pour half of the sauce in a grill safe stock pot or roasting pan that will be large enough to hold all the meatballs
node.step_6: place the pot / pan on the grill away from the direct heat when the fire is ready
node.step_7: when the grill is ready place the meatballs directly over the heat and sear on both the top and bottom for 3-5 minutes per side
node.step_8: when you are done searing the meatballs , place them away from the direct heat
node.step_9: let them cook for 5-8 more minutes or until the meatballs are firm , but not fully cooked and then place all the meatballs in the pot / pan and place that directly over the heat source
node.step_10: cook for an additional 8-10 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 155-160 degrees f

node.name: grilled lime marinated flank steak with chipotle honey sauce
node.steps: ['to marinate steak: place the steak in a large dish or baking pan', 'mix together the chipotle , garlic , cilantro , vegetable oil , and lime juice in a bowl and pour over the steak', 'cover , and marinate in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours , turning occasionally', 'prepare the grill', 'for sauce: combine the chipotles , honey , peanut oil , vinegar , mustard , lime juice , garlic , and cumin in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth', 'stir in the cilantro and season with salt and pepper to taste', 'to prepare steak: remove the steak and season with salt and pepper', 'grill over high heat for about 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare , 7 minutes on each side for medium , or to the desired doneness', 'remove the steak from the grill and let it rest for about 4 minutes', 'with a sharp knife , thinly slice the steak across the grain and at a sharp angle', 'to serve: serve the steak on top of a slice of the french bread and accompany each serving with several tablespoons of the sauce']
node.description: the flank is not the tenderest cut of beef, but it may be the most flavorful. to make it tenderer, i marinate it and slice it against the grain very thin on the bias after cooking it. so what you start with is very thin steak, and what you end up with is large thin slices of char-flavored meat that resembles roast beef. the acid in the lime marinade is very complementary to the char flavor of the meet. marinated it anywhere from 4 to 6 hours: any longer than that, and the lime juice will actually cook the steak, leaving you with gray meat. recipe adapted from chris schlesinger adopted 9/06
node.ingredients: ['flank steaks', 'chipotle chile', 'garlic cloves', 'cilantro', 'vegetable oil', 'lime juice', 'canned chipotle chiles', 'honey', 'peanut oil', 'balsamic vinegar', 'brown mustard', 'ground cumin', 'fresh cilantro', 'salt', 'cracked black pepper', 'french bread']
node.step_1: to marinate steak: place the steak in a large dish or baking pan
node.step_2: mix together the chipotle , garlic , cilantro , vegetable oil , and lime juice in a bowl and pour over the steak
node.step_3: cover , and marinate in the refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours , turning occasionally
node.step_4: prepare the grill
node.step_5: for sauce: combine the chipotles , honey , peanut oil , vinegar , mustard , lime juice , garlic , and cumin in a blender or food processor and puree until smooth
node.step_6: stir in the cilantro and season with salt and pepper to taste
node.step_7: to prepare steak: remove the steak and season with salt and pepper
node.step_8: grill over high heat for about 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare , 7 minutes on each side for medium , or to the desired doneness
node.step_9: remove the steak from the grill and let it rest for about 4 minutes
node.step_10: with a sharp knife , thinly slice the steak across the grain and at a sharp angle
node.step_11: to serve: serve the steak on top of a slice of the french bread and accompany each serving with several tablespoons of the sauce

node.description: i love pork tenderloin, and this recipe, adapted from eating well magazine (aug/sept 2006 issue), is a terrific way to prepare it. cutting the meat into medallions not only makes it super-quick to grill (please don't overcook pork tenderloin!), it also allows the marinade to add more of its flavor and makes an attractive presentation. i marinated this around 7 hours, rather than the 2 called for in the recipe. the magazine suggested serving with snow peas and brown rice. cooking/passive work time includes 2 hours to marinate.

node.step_3: place pork in a heavy duty , resealable plastic bag and add marinade
node.step_4: squeeze air out and seal
node.step_5: turn the bag to coat the medallions , then refrigerate for 2 hours , turning the bag once to redistribute the marinade
node.step_6: preheat grill to medium
node.step_7: remove pork from marinade
node.step_8: grill until just cooked through , 3 to 5 minutes per side
node.step_9: they are not the same
node.step_10: pork tenderloin is a very lean , tender cut from the loin section
node.step_11: it is long and slender , and usually weighs between 3 / 4 and 1 1 / 2 pounds
node.step_12: it has a mild flavor , so it benefits from being prepared with a rub , marinade or sauce , but does not benefit from extended cooking
node.step_13: to keep tenderloin juicy , make sure you don't overcook it
node.step_14: contrary to rules from the past , most pork now is safe and best enjoyed still slightly pink in the center

node.step_10: prepare bbq to medium heat
node.step_11: remove pork from marinade and discard marinade
node.step_12: grill pork until internal temperature registers 155f turning frequently , about 35 minutes
node.step_13: meanwhile , in a heavy medium saucepan , boil remaining sauce until reduced by half , about 5 minutes
node.step_14: add peaches
node.step_15: stir until heated through , about 1 minute
node.step_16: slice pork , arrange on platter , and spoon some of the sauce over
node.step_17: top with chives
node.step_18: serve
node.step_19: pass remaining sauce at the table

node.name: grilled pork tenderloin with spicy peach glaze
node.steps: ['heat the grill to medium hot', 'in a medium mixing bowl , combine the preserves , garlic , olive oil , soy sauce , dry mustard , cayenne pepper , salt and black pepper , and mix well to combine', 'sprinkle the tenderloins with additional salt and pepper and place on the grill', 'cook about 10 minutes on each side before brushing the upturned side with the glaze', 'continue cooking for another 10 to 12 minutes , turning every 3 to 5 minutes and brushing each upturned side with glaze every time , until the meat is cooked through', 'move the pork to a cooler part of the grill if it starts to get too dark before it is cooked through', 'place the peach halves on the grill , cut-side down , and grill 2 minutes', 'turn , and brush the tops with the glaze', 'grill 3 ro 5 minutes more , until the peaches are soft and the cavities fill with juices', 'transfer the cooked pork and peaches to a serving plate & serve immediately']
node.description: a friend gave me this recipe and said it was from martha stewart. the original recipe calls for chicken, but i use it for pork tenderloin. i am sure it would be great on chicken as well. super easy, moist and flavorful.
node.ingredients: ['peach preserves', 'garlic', 'olive oil', 'soy sauce', 'dry mustard', 'cayenne pepper', 'salt', 'fresh ground black pepper', 'pork tenderloin', 'peaches']
node.step_1: heat the grill to medium hot
node.step_2: in a medium mixing bowl , combine the preserves , garlic , olive oil , soy sauce , dry mustard , cayenne pepper , salt and black pepper , and mix well to combine
node.step_3: sprinkle the tenderloins with additional salt and pepper and place on the grill
node.step_4: cook about 10 minutes on each side before brushing the upturned side with the glaze
node.step_5: continue cooking for another 10 to 12 minutes , turning every 3 to 5 minutes and brushing each upturned side with glaze every time , until the meat is cooked through
node.step_6: move the pork to a cooler part of the grill if it starts to get too dark before it is cooked through
node.step_7: place the peach halves on the grill , cut-side down , and grill 2 minutes
node.step_8: turn , and brush the tops with the glaze
node.step_9: grill 3 ro 5 minutes more , until the peaches are soft and the cavities fill with juices
node.step_10: transfer the cooked pork and peaches to a serving plate & serve immediately

node.name: grilled portabella and poblano tacos
node.steps: ['preheat a lightly oiled grill on medium-high heat', 'while the grill is heating up , prepare the pico de gallo', 'in a small mixing bowl , combine tomatoes , onion , cilantro , garlic , salt and lime juice', 'set aside', 'next , prepare the grilled portabella filling', 'remove the stems from the portabellas , and discard', 'using a spoon , scrape out the dark gills from the underside of the mushroom caps', 'lightly brush the portabellas and the onions on both sides with canola oil , and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper', 'arrange the mushrooms , onion , and poblano on the hot grill , and cook for 5-6 minutes per side or until the mushrooms are softened and the onion is lightly charred', 'remove from heat and transfer to a cutting board', 'remove the stem and seeds from the poblano , and discard', 'cut the poblano and the portabellas into thin strips , and roughly chop the onion', 'transfer to a mixing bowl and toss with lime juice and chipotle powder until well coated', 'to assemble , arrange 2 tortillas per plate , and divide the mushroom filling evenly between them', 'serve with pico de gallo and bowls of the different toppings so that everyone can garnish their tacos as they please']
node.description: in these tacos, strips of meaty grilled portabella join up with grilled onions and poblano peppers, and then get a quick toss with smoky chipotle powder and tangy lime juice to create a taco filling so flavourful and satisfying that even the most devoted of meat eaters won't complain.
node.ingredients: ['roma tomatoes', 'red onion', 'fresh cilantro', 'garlic clove', 'salt', 'lime juice', 'portabella mushrooms', 'canola oil', 'salt and pepper', 'poblano chile', 'olive oil', 'dried chipotle powder', 'corn tortillas', 'guacamole', 'fresh cilantro stem', 'lime wedge', 'monterey jack cheese']
node.step_1: preheat a lightly oiled grill on medium-high heat
node.step_2: while the grill is heating up , prepare the pico de gallo
node.step_3: in a small mixing bowl , combine tomatoes , onion , cilantro , garlic , salt and lime juice
node.step_4: set aside
node.step_5: next , prepare the grilled portabella filling
node.step_6: remove the stems from the portabellas , and discard
node.step_7: using a spoon , scrape out the dark gills from the underside of the mushroom caps
node.step_8: lightly brush the portabellas and the onions on both sides with canola oil , and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper
node.step_9: arrange the mushrooms , onion , and poblano on the hot grill , and cook for 5-6 minutes per side or until the mushrooms are softened and the onion is lightly charred
node.step_10: remove from heat and transfer to a cutting board
node.step_11: remove the stem and seeds from the poblano , and discard
node.step_12: cut the poblano and the portabellas into thin strips , and roughly chop the onion
node.step_13: transfer to a mixing bowl and toss with lime juice and chipotle powder until well coated
node.step_14: to assemble , arrange 2 tortillas per plate , and divide the mushroom filling evenly between them
node.step_15: serve with pico de gallo and bowls of the different toppings so that everyone can garnish their tacos as they please

node.description: want an impressive side for a summer bbq? this is the way to go. very little prep time and really no fuss. you can even serive it as an appetizer. i deliberatly use dried spices so i know i've got what i need on hand. my husband doesn't eat dairy, but i imagine topping with a gorgonzola or even a hard cheese like parmesan or romano would be a great addition.

node.step_3: spoon oil mixture spreading evenly on underside of each cap and let soak inches make sure to reserve enough to brush on top of cap
node.step_4: grill on high
node.step_5: i have a "searing" panel on my bbq grill that i prefer to use
node.step_6: grill with underside down , and baste top with remaining oil mix
node.step_7: when underside is well done flip over and grill again for same length of time

node.name: grilled portobello mushrooms shallots with rosemary dijon
node.steps: ['thread shallots through roots and stem ends onto 2 metal skewers', 'scrape most of the gills out of the mushrooms', 'using sharp knife , cut -inch slits , spaced inch apart , in crosshatch pattern on non-gill side of mushrooms', 'brush shallots and mushrooms evenly with cup olive oil and season with 2 teaspoons kosher salt and pepper to taste', 'whisk remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil , garlic , lemon juice , mustard , rosemary , and teaspoon kosher salt together in small bowl , set aside', 'grill vegetables over medium heat , brushing with sauce , turning several times , until tender and caramelized , 16 to 18 minutes', 'transfer vegetables to platter', 'remove skewers from shallots and discard any charred outer layers', 're-whisk remaining marinade , pour over vegetables , and serve']
node.description: these can easily become the star attraction to your next grilled meal! for the grilling itself, build a moderate, medium-heat fire. the veggies come out tender and full of smoky flavor and can be served warm or at room temp. if grill marks do not appear after 5 minutes, adjust either the heat level or the position on the grill. i have made these with chunks of red onion with equally good results. these have great flavor! interesting factoid: once the mushroom reaches 4 to 6" in diameter, it is called a portobello rather than a portabella. adapted from cook's illustrated magazine, may, 2009. hope you enjoy.
node.ingredients: ['shallots', 'mixed mushrooms', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'salt & fresh ground pepper', 'garlic cloves', 'lemon juice', 'dijon mustard', 'fresh rosemary']
node.step_1: thread shallots through roots and stem ends onto 2 metal skewers
node.step_2: scrape most of the gills out of the mushrooms
node.step_3: using sharp knife , cut -inch slits , spaced inch apart , in crosshatch pattern on non-gill side of mushrooms
node.step_4: brush shallots and mushrooms evenly with cup olive oil and season with 2 teaspoons kosher salt and pepper to taste
node.step_5: whisk remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil , garlic , lemon juice , mustard , rosemary , and teaspoon kosher salt together in small bowl , set aside
node.step_6: grill vegetables over medium heat , brushing with sauce , turning several times , until tender and caramelized , 16 to 18 minutes
node.step_7: transfer vegetables to platter
node.step_8: remove skewers from shallots and discard any charred outer layers
node.step_9: re-whisk remaining marinade , pour over vegetables , and serve

node.step_1: for dough: combine water and sugar in processor
node.step_2: sprinkle yeast over
node.step_3: let stand until foamy , about 10 minutes
node.step_4: add oil , then 3 cups flour and salt
node.step_5: process until dough comes together , about 1 minute
node.step_6: turn dough out onto floured work surface
node.step_7: sprinkle with rosemary
node.step_8: knead until dough is smooth and elastic , adding more flour by tablespoonfuls if dough is sticky , about 5 minutes
node.step_9: lightly oil large bowl
node.step_10: add dough
node.step_11: turn to coat with oil
node.step_12: cover bowl with plastic , then towel
node.step_13: let stand in warm , draft-free area until dough doubles , about 1 hour
node.step_14: punch down dough
node.step_15: knead in bowl until smooth , about 2 minutes
node.step_16: for toppings: whisk first 4 ingredients in medium bowl
node.step_17: let vinaigrette stand 15 minutes at room temperature or refrigerate for up to 2 hours
node.step_18: prepare bbq
node.step_19: arrange sausages , peppers and onion on baking sheet
node.step_22: grill sausages until cooked through and peppers and onion until slightly charred and crisp-tender , turning and basting occasionally , about 12 minutes for sausage and 8 minutes for peppers and onion
node.step_23: transfer sausage and vegetables to cutting board
node.step_24: cut sausages into -inch pieces and peppers into thin strips
node.step_25: to finish: add coals to bbq , if necessary
node.step_27: stretch out each piece on floured surface to 9-inch round
node.step_29: grill over medium heat until top of dough puffs and underside is crisp , about 3 minutes
node.step_32: transfer to baking sheet with well-grilled side up
node.step_34: sprinkle each with of mozzarella and parmesan
node.step_35: top each with of sausage , peppers and onion , then with of goat cheese , tomatoes and green onions
node.step_37: using large metal spatula , return 2 pizzas to grill
node.step_38: close grill or cover pizzas loosely with foil
node.step_39: grill until cheeses melt and dough is cooked through and browned , using tongs to rotate pizzas for even cooking , about 5 minutes

node.step_1: thaw fish , if frozen

node.step_3: pat dry
node.step_4: set aside

node.name: grilled salmon with chili lime sauce
node.steps: ['to marinate the fish , combine the oil , ginger , garlic , shallots , fish sauce , soy sauce , and sugar in a medium bowl', 'stir until sugar is dissolved and everything is mixed well', 'place the salmon fillets in the bowl and turn to coat with the marinade', 'cover and set aside for 20 to 30 minutes , or cover and refrigerate for up to 1 day', 'to prepare the sauce , combine all ingredients listed for the sauce in a small bowl', 'stir to dissolve the sugar and mix everything well', 'to cook the fish , build a hot charcoal fire or preheat a gas grill', 'place the fish carefully on the grill for about 5 minutes on each side , depending on the thickness of the fish and how well you like it done', 'transfer to a serving platter alongside the chili-lime sauce and serve hot or warm']
node.description: we just love salmon and really enjoyed this recipe for it, which was adapted from quick & easy vietnamese. you can sub another meaty fish, if you wish, such as tuna or halibut.
node.ingredients: ['vegetable oil', 'fresh ginger', 'garlic', 'shallot', 'fish sauce', 'soy sauce', 'sugar', 'salmon fillets', 'lime juice', 'water', 'chili-garlic sauce', 'green onion']
node.step_1: to marinate the fish , combine the oil , ginger , garlic , shallots , fish sauce , soy sauce , and sugar in a medium bowl
node.step_2: stir until sugar is dissolved and everything is mixed well
node.step_3: place the salmon fillets in the bowl and turn to coat with the marinade
node.step_4: cover and set aside for 20 to 30 minutes , or cover and refrigerate for up to 1 day
node.step_5: to prepare the sauce , combine all ingredients listed for the sauce in a small bowl
node.step_6: stir to dissolve the sugar and mix everything well
node.step_7: to cook the fish , build a hot charcoal fire or preheat a gas grill
node.step_8: place the fish carefully on the grill for about 5 minutes on each side , depending on the thickness of the fish and how well you like it done
node.step_9: transfer to a serving platter alongside the chili-lime sauce and serve hot or warm

node.step_1: leave skin on the salmon & place it in a shallow dish

node.step_4: peel cucumbers , then slice thinly

node.step_10: best served hot , with new potatoes & the cucumber salad

node.name: grilled salmon with quick blueberry pan sauce
node.steps: ['heat 1 tb oil in large skillet over medium heat', 'add shallots', 'saute until softened , about 5 minutes', 'add garlic , 1 / 4 tsp coarse salt , 1 / 4 tsp thyme , and 1 / 8 tsp allspice', 'stir until fragrant , about 30 seconds', 'add blueberries , 1 / 4 cup water , and vinegar', 'stir to blend', 'mash berries with a potato masher or back of fork and cook until sauce thickens , stirring often , 3 to 4 minutes', 'season with freshly ground black pepper', 'remove from heat', 'brush grill rack with oil', 'prepare bbq', 'brush salmon on both sides with oil', 'sprinkle with coarse salt , thyme , allspice , and black pepper', 'grill salmon until just opaque in center , 4 to 5 minutes per side', 'transfer to plates', 'stir 2 tb sliced mint into warm blueberry sauce', 'spoon sauce over salmon and sprinkle with remaining 1 tb mint', 'serve immediately']
node.description: dh and i made this recipe the other night from bon appetit and absolutely loved it. dh was very skeptical and complained mighty heartily at the beginning about serving his salmon with a blueberry sauce. however, once the sauce was made and thickened up, you really would not have known that it was made from blueberries. we both agreed it was delicious.
node.ingredients: ['olive oil', 'shallot', 'garlic clove', 'kosher salt', 'fresh thyme', 'ground allspice', 'fresh blueberries', 'water', 'balsamic vinegar', 'salmon steaks', 'of fresh mint']
node.step_1: heat 1 tb oil in large skillet over medium heat
node.step_2: add shallots
node.step_3: saute until softened , about 5 minutes
node.step_4: add garlic , 1 / 4 tsp coarse salt , 1 / 4 tsp thyme , and 1 / 8 tsp allspice
node.step_5: stir until fragrant , about 30 seconds
node.step_6: add blueberries , 1 / 4 cup water , and vinegar
node.step_7: stir to blend
node.step_8: mash berries with a potato masher or back of fork and cook until sauce thickens , stirring often , 3 to 4 minutes
node.step_9: season with freshly ground black pepper
node.step_10: remove from heat
node.step_11: brush grill rack with oil
node.step_12: prepare bbq
node.step_13: brush salmon on both sides with oil
node.step_14: sprinkle with coarse salt , thyme , allspice , and black pepper
node.step_15: grill salmon until just opaque in center , 4 to 5 minutes per side
node.step_16: transfer to plates
node.step_17: stir 2 tb sliced mint into warm blueberry sauce
node.step_18: spoon sauce over salmon and sprinkle with remaining 1 tb mint
node.step_19: serve immediately
