node.description: entered for safe-keeping. from simply classic by jr league of seattle. elegant. northwest u.s. cuisine. may use either fresh red bell peppers, roasted, or canned roasted red peppers. note: reviews recommended use of reduced sodium chicken broth in lieu of regular chicken stock as the sauce seemed too salty. likewise, i would also use unsalted butter. i normally substitute the reduced sodium ingredients while cooking anyway out of force of habit.
node.ingredients: ['red bell peppers', 'chicken stock', 'dry white wine', 'dried basil', 'butter', 'large scallops', 'salt', 'pepper', 'bamboo skewers']
node.step_1: soak 12 bamboo skewers in water for at least 30 minutes
node.step_2: sauce:
node.step_3: place roasted peppers , stock and wine in processor or blender
node.step_4: puree until smooth
node.step_5: pour into a 12-inch skillet
node.step_6: add basil and cook over medium-high heat until mixture is reduced to about 1 1 / 2 cups
node.step_7: reduce heat to medium and add chilled butter a little at a time
node.step_8: stir until melted and completely incorporated into sauce
node.step_9: remove from heat , cover and keep warm
node.step_10: scallops:
node.step_11: drain water from skewers
node.step_12: divide scallops evenly among the skewers and brush with melted butter
node.step_13: place skewers on grill 2-4 inches above very hot coals
node.step_14: cook , turning once , until scallops are opaque in the thickest part , about 3-5 minutes
node.step_15: divide sauce among 6 warm dinner plates
node.step_16: remove scallops from skewers and place on top of sauce
node.step_17: sprinkle with salt and pepper
node.step_18: serve immediately

node.description: these are probably the healthiest burgers i've ever made ... and surprisingly simple and tasty! my inspiration was the shrimp boulette po' boy burger from the burger meister cookbook but i made numerous changes to suit hubby's taste. i will definitely make these again to help use up extra burger buns.

node.step_3: season with salt and pepper to taste
node.step_4: gently form mixture into six to eight 3 / 4-inch-thick burgers
node.step_5: cover the burgers and refrigerate for 30 minutes or until needed
node.step_6: grill burgers 5 to 6 minutes on each side , basting with approximately 1 teaspoon of worcestershire sauce per burger while grilling

node.description: the original recipe is from cook's illustrated. tossing the grilled shrimp in the sauce makes this really good!

node.name: grilled skirt steak with avocado tomato salsa
node.steps: ['place all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and mix', 'place skirt steak and marinade in a ziplock bag and put in the fridge for 2 to 4 hours', 'meanwhile , mix all the salsa ingredients in a bowl , cover and refrigerate', 'place oven on 200f and wrap your tortillas , sealed in foil for about 20 minutes', 'prepare your barbecue for medium heat grilling', 'remove steak from the marinade and place on the grill for 4 to 6 minutes on each side', 'slice the sweet onion and place on the grill as well , brushing with the marinade', 'grill until still firm , but just turning tender', 'place the steak and onions on a carving platter', 'slice the steak thinly on the diagonal and serve on a platter with the onion', 'to eat , place some steak , onion and avocado-tomato salsa in a warm tortilla and enjoy !']
node.description: living in california, we often see skirt steak available. i found this recipe to be fairly authentic to how they grill it out here. you can use lemon juice, but definitely use the lime juice if you can. the onion is wonderful with this but tends to fall though the grill grates, so have an extra sweet onion sliced thick to grill as well. allow 2 to 4 hours to marinade. (time for marinading is included in the cooking time)
node.ingredients: ['olive oil', 'fresh lime juice', 'garlic clove', 'onion', 'sweet onion', 'black pepper', 'salt', 'skirt steaks', 'corn tortillas', 'tomatoes', 'avocado', 'red onion', 'cilantro', 'jalapeno chile', 'fresh lemon juice']
node.step_1: place all the marinade ingredients in a bowl and mix
node.step_2: place skirt steak and marinade in a ziplock bag and put in the fridge for 2 to 4 hours
node.step_3: meanwhile , mix all the salsa ingredients in a bowl , cover and refrigerate
node.step_4: place oven on 200f and wrap your tortillas , sealed in foil for about 20 minutes
node.step_5: prepare your barbecue for medium heat grilling
node.step_6: remove steak from the marinade and place on the grill for 4 to 6 minutes on each side
node.step_7: slice the sweet onion and place on the grill as well , brushing with the marinade
node.step_8: grill until still firm , but just turning tender
node.step_9: place the steak and onions on a carving platter
node.step_10: slice the steak thinly on the diagonal and serve on a platter with the onion
node.step_11: to eat , place some steak , onion and avocado-tomato salsa in a warm tortilla and enjoy !

node.step_4: combine cheese with 2 tablespoons salsa
node.step_5: spoon over 6 of the patties
node.step_6: cover each with one of the remaining patties , making a 'sandwich' , pinching edges together to seal
node.step_7: grill approximately 7 minutes on each side , or until cooked through
node.step_8: meanwhile , combine remaining 2 tablespoons salsa with remaining 1 tablespoon mayo
node.step_9: place a lettuce leaf , tomato slice and burger on bottom half of bun
node.step_10: top with salsa mixture
node.step_11: cover with top of bun

node.name: grilled soy honey glazed chicken breasts
node.steps: ['combine scallions , garlic , honey , sherry , ginger and soy sauce', 'place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and pour the sauce over the chicken', 'close the bag and marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour', 'or , refrigerate it overnight', 'turn occasionally to keep sauce distributed evenly on the chicken', 'remove chicken from bag and pour sauce into a small saucepan', 'bring sauce to a boil and let boil for one full minute', 'grill chicken over hot coals , turning as needed to prevent charring and to cook evenly', 'grill until just done , about 25 minutes', 'brush with sauce as needed to keep moist', 'serve chicken with remaining sauce and hot cooked rice']
node.description: this is a recipe i do after work during the summer when i'm trying to keep the kitchen cool. i prepare it in the morning and let the chicken marinate in the fridge all day. prep time does not include marinating time.
node.ingredients: ['chicken breasts', 'scallion', 'garlic', 'honey', 'dry sherry', 'fresh ginger', 'soy sauce']
node.step_1: combine scallions , garlic , honey , sherry , ginger and soy sauce
node.step_2: place chicken in a resealable plastic bag and pour the sauce over the chicken
node.step_3: close the bag and marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour
node.step_4: or , refrigerate it overnight
node.step_5: turn occasionally to keep sauce distributed evenly on the chicken
node.step_6: remove chicken from bag and pour sauce into a small saucepan
node.step_7: bring sauce to a boil and let boil for one full minute
node.step_8: grill chicken over hot coals , turning as needed to prevent charring and to cook evenly
node.step_9: grill until just done , about 25 minutes
node.step_10: brush with sauce as needed to keep moist
node.step_11: serve chicken with remaining sauce and hot cooked rice

node.step_3: sprinkle with mrs

node.name: grilled steak

node.description: this tender steak has a sweet asian touch flavored with pineapple, crystallized ginger,teriyaki sauce, garlic & port wine. quick and easy! can be made with pork or chicken.
node.ingredients: ['crushed pineapple', 'crystallized ginger', 'teriyaki sauce', 'garlic', 'onions', 'brown sugar', 'black pepper', 'steak', 'port wine']
node.step_1: place all ingredients except for steak in storage bag and give a shake to mix marinade
node.step_2: add steak and marinade 6-8 hours or even overnight
node.step_3: remove steak from marinade
node.step_4: bring steak to room temperature
node.step_5: place marinade in a small saucepan add 2 tablespoons port and simmer 5-10 minutes
node.step_6: grill steak on a medium high heat for 4-6 minutes each side
node.step_7: let steak sit for 10 minutes before slicing and serve along with the hot sauce

node.name: grilled steaks with berry sauce
node.steps: ['preheat your grill to medium heat', 'while grill is heating , prepare the sauce by combining jam and vinegar in a small saucepan over medium heat , stirring constantly until jam is melted', 'once melted remove from heat', 'rub pepper onto both sides of each steak', 'grill steaks over medium heat for about 8-12 minutes , or until cooked to your liking , turning once', 'when steaks are cooked , set onto plates and pour sauce to taste over each and garnish with berries', "you may also choose to broil these , according to your broiler's instructions , for the same time as for grilling"]
node.description: adapted from pillsbury's complete cookbook.
node.ingredients: ['new york strip steaks', 'fresh blackberries', 'fresh coarse ground black pepper', 'salt', 'blackberry jam', 'red wine vinegar']
node.step_1: preheat your grill to medium heat
node.step_2: while grill is heating , prepare the sauce by combining jam and vinegar in a small saucepan over medium heat , stirring constantly until jam is melted
node.step_3: once melted remove from heat
node.step_4: rub pepper onto both sides of each steak
node.step_5: grill steaks over medium heat for about 8-12 minutes , or until cooked to your liking , turning once
node.step_6: when steaks are cooked , set onto plates and pour sauce to taste over each and garnish with berries
node.step_7: you may also choose to broil these , according to your broiler's instructions , for the same time as for grilling
